title: System Design - Electrical Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Company OverviewAt Hexagon US Federal we provide cutting-edge technologies and a wide range of professional services to enable our customers to make smarter and faster operational decisions and improve mission effectiveness.Hexagon US Federal is an independent subsidiary of Hexagon Corporation exclusively focused on bringing the broad range of Hexagon technologies to the US Federal government and its partners. Position Overview: A highly motived, experienced electrical design engineer that will be tasked with working within a collaborative design team from requirements based existing and new design efforts. Design team will be responsible for the selection and/or development of electronic suites of equipment for industrial and DoD use. Electrical design engineering position utilizes CAD/CAM/PLM based software packages to create detailed product drawings and 3D models of new products, product assemblies, and engineering change orders. The position requires collaboration internal to the department between engineering, production, and support staff. Key Responsibilities: * Create detailed product models/drawings for new discreet parts and products, product redesign, product revisions and associated integration product assemblies' drawings. Performs various drafting, illustrative, technical, manual, and supporting administrative duties as required in support of new part numbers, Bills of Material (BOM), Engineering Change Notices (ECNs) and drawings. Performs maintenance of system generated files for engineering and customer changes. Prepare Bill of Materials (BOMs) for product implementation into production. Maintains and reconciles revisions between drawing files, model files, and productions systems. Collaborates with engineering and manufacturing to develop, create, and implement 3D software models, assemblies, illustrations following defined submittals and engineering drawings processes in support of prototypes, final design, manufacturing, and quality specifications. Interfaces with engineers, customers, and other organizations to verify that data pertaining to product specification is documented accurately. Works with fabricators on model files, drawing clarifications, and build operations on submitted 3rd party builds. Minimum Qualifications: * 1-3 years of experience * Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering. Requires attention to detail on all aspects of assigned tasks. Shall be self-motivated and task completion oriented. The ability to effectively work in a collaborative, team-based environment as well as independently. Shall possess the ability to multi-task and prioritize efforts in a fast-paced environment. Shall have the ability to learn new processes, design applications and features. Shall have basic computer skills including typical Microsoft office software applications. Shall have a record of punctuality and regular on-site attendance. Shall display good communication and interpersonal skills. Experience utilizing industry 3D design packages. Possess the ability to provide independent checking efficiently on drawings and model files. Shall have the ability to obtain a security clearance if required. Shall have prior experience in using a computer-aided design (CAD) system (Solid Edge, SolidWorks, or similar). Shall have the expertise to produce quality engineering drawings and understand typical engineering standards and workflows. Shall be proficient in the design of cables for fabrication and understanding of usage (Data, Power, etc.). Shall have the ability to select commercial off the shelf and customer electronics for use in designs including the understanding of power requirements, calculations, etc. Shall have the ability to create, modify, and maintain electrical system drawing packages. Shall have the knowledge, skill, and ability to understand and interpret product drawings across multiple functional groups (i.e., interface of electrical hardware to mechanical assemblies). Shall have the ability to integrate and verify all levels of electrical hardware. Shall have the ability to lift 25lbs. Shall have the ability to operate basic hand tools and work standing or sitting for an extended period. Preferred Qualifications: * Experience utilizing Solid Edge. Four or more years' electrical cabling design/drafting experience. Some experience in a lab environment. Experience with military hardware designs/standards. Experience with EMI/RFI design and testing. Required Level of Security Clearance: Ability to Obtain Secret Clearance. Security Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration. What we will provide in return: Competitive health care plans with savings accounts Dental and vision plans 401k with 100% company match up to 6%, with immediate vesting on company match Life and disability insurance Learning Management System with robust offerings Tuition Reimbursement Program Paid Time Off 13 paid holidays per year Thrive Wellness Program DE&I Committee with regular educational sessions and communications Leadership Development Program with multiple learning options At Hexagon US Federal, we believe that diversity of experience and thought makes us stronger. With both customers and employees around the world, we are committed to ensuring our team reflects the unique communities around us. We are pleased to offer a Diversity, Equity, & Inclusion Program: this employee-led program offers monthly speakers, newsletters, training, outreach and more as well as VALOR (Veterans and Allies: Leadership, Outreach, Resources): our veterans' employee resource group. We encourage applicants across any race, ethnicity, gender/gender expression, age, ability and more. If you need accommodations to make our process more accessible to you, please email us at . We can't wait to meet you! Hexagon US Federal is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, disability status, or any protected category prohibited by local, state or federal laws.

title: Mechanical Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Anduril Industries is a defense technology company with a mission to transform U.S. and allied military capabilities with advanced technology. By bringing the expertise, technology, and business model of the 21st century’s most innovative companies to the defense industry, Anduril is changing how military systems are designed, built and sold. Anduril’s family of systems is powered by Lattice OS, an AI-powered operating system that turns thousands of data streams into a realtime, 3D command and control center. As the world enters an era of strategic competition, Anduril is committed to bringing cutting-edge autonomy, AI, computer vision, sensor fusion, and networking technology to the military in months, not years. Anduril’s Rocket Motor Systems group is seeking a Mechanical Engineer to join our team. The Rocket Motor Systems group designs, develops, and manufactures next-generation solid rocket motors for defense and space applications at Anduril. As Mechanical Engineer, you will conduct mechanical design and analysis of solid rocket motor components, including motor cases, nozzles, propellant grains, igniters, and ignition safety components. The right person for this role has a strong understanding of mechanical design, stress analysis, and thermal analysis principles, as well as a solid handle on the usage of tools common in industry. If you are someone who is hardware-focused and detail-oriented then this role is for you. WHAT YOU'LL DOPerform CAD design activities of mechanical components.Perform finite element analysis of structural and thermal systems.Generate, review, and release product definition (i.e. engineering drawings).Create reports and presentations documenting analysis and other supporting work.Present to peers and customers in design reviews.Support prototyping, manufacturing, and test operations onsite at our manufacturing facilities and suppliers’ facilities.Own the development of critical subsystems from cradle to grave. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONSA minimum of 2 years’ experience performing mechanical design and analysisA bachelor’s degree in mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, or similar, or a comparable combination of education and applicable experience.Prior experience operating CAD software and/or FEA softwareA solid understanding of hardware manufacturability and Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing.Strong communication skills.Ability to travel to other Anduril sites, customer sites, or supplier sites as business demand dictates. Anticipated 10-25% travel.U.S. Person status is required as this position needs to access export-controlled data. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONSAdvanced degree (masters or doctorate) in mechanical or aerospace engineering, or similar.Experience with Solidworks CAD software and/or Abaqus FEA software.Certification in Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing.Expertise in engineering tool development in Microsoft Excel, MATLAB, and/or Python.Experience with propulsion systemsAbility to obtain and hold a U.S. Top Secret Security Clearance. BENEFITSPlatinum Benefits: We offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision, life) and cover 100 percent of the premiums for you and your dependents.16 Weeks paid parental leave for all caregiversFamily planning: We’re proud to offer comprehensive family planning support. Fertility planning and treatment, adoption support, gestational carrier support and fertility preservation are all included.Unlimited Provisions: From breakfast to dinner, our kitchen team has you covered with healthy meals and snacks at every office.Relocation assistanceUnlimited Time Off The salary range for this role is an estimate based on a wide range of compensation factors, inclusive of base salary only. Actual salary offer may vary based on (but not limited to) work experience, education and/or training, critical skills, and/or business considerations. Highly competitive equity grants are included in the majority of full time offers; and are considered part of Anduril's total compensation package. Additionally, Anduril offers top-tier benefits for full-time employees, including:Platinum Healthcare Benefits: For U.S. roles, we offer top tier platinum coverage (medical, dental, vision) that are 100% covered by Anduril for you and 90% covered for your dependents.For UK roles, Private Medical Insurance (PMI): Anduril will cover the full cost of the insurance premium for an employee and dependents.For AUS roles, Private health plan through Bupa: Coverage is fully subsidized by Anduril.Basic Life/AD&D and long-term disability insurance 100% covered by Anduril, plus the option to purchase additional life insurance for you and your dependents.Extremely generous company holiday calendar including a holiday hiatus in December, and highly competitive PTO plans.16 weeks of paid Caregiver & Wellness Leave to care for a family member, bond with your baby, or tend to your own medical condition.Family Planning & Parenting Support: Fertility (eg, IVF, preservation), adoption, and gestational carrier coverage with additional benefits and resources to provide support from planning to parenting.Mental Health Resources: We provide free mental health resources 24/7 including therapy, life coaching, and more. Additional work-life services, such as free legal and financial support, available to you as well.A professional development stipend is available to all Andurilians.Daily Meals and Provisions: For many of our offices this means breakfast, lunch and fully stocked micro-kitchens.Company-funded commuter benefits available based on your region.Relocation assistance (depending on role eligibility).401(k) retirement savings plan - both a traditional and Roth 401(k). (US roles only) The recruiter assigned to this role can share more information about the specific compensation and benefit details associated with this role during the hiring process. Anduril is an equal-opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace. The Anduril team is made up of incredibly talented and unique individuals, who together are disrupting industry norms by creating new paths towards the future of defense technology. title: Test Engineer II- Secret with Security Clearance
job_description: Your Impact: Jacobs is hiring for a Test Engineer to support our team in Huntsville, AL. You will be working in Department of Justice organization that's mission is to accelerate operations through data and new analytical insights. The entire section works to provide the entire enterprise with tools and applications to assist with operational data discovery, data exploitation, data analytics, and data visualization tools. The section works closely with the entire enterprise to ensure its applications and tools meet or exceed the needs of the mission. The Test Engineer position is a part of a team that tests on premises and cloud-based applications. In addition to standard application testing, the team also has a focus on automating testing utilizing a fully implemented CI/CD pipeline. The team utilizes agile methodologies to plan projects and tasks and break them down into 2-week sprints. The team is made up of cloud engineers and developers working closely together to complete projects for the customer. We are looking for test engineers that want to implement and learn cutting-edge cloud technologies and services to support our customer and their multiple national security missions. The tester should have experience in both functional and automated testing. This is an exciting opportunity for cleared talent with a Secret clearance to obtain a Top Secret clearance. Estimated time to complete the clearance sponsorship process is approximately 12-15 months. Once the Top Secret clearance is fully adjudicated and a position is available, the candidate will be eligible to work on the program. #divergent Here's what you'll need:Active Secret Clearance3 years of experience with development and scripting languages3 years of experience with test automation tools such as Jasmine, Karma, Selenium or JunitExperience with integrating test automation frameworks into a CI/CD pipeline Preferred:Experience working in an agile scrum environmentExperience with Jira and ConfluenceExperience with Selenium or another automated testing tool

title: Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Athenix Special Missions (ASM) is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer at the Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support (MTCCS)-Centers of Excellence (COE) Schools at Fort Novosel, AL. ASM Quality Policy: To meet or exceed customers' expectation for quality, delivery, and service through continual improvement, striving to meet our objectives, and committing to meeting all legal and statutory requirements. Summary: Athenix Special Missions is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer to provide Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support II (MTCCS) technical and functional Constructive Simulation and Gaming support to TRADOC Centers of Excellence (COE) and Schools. This work provides technical and functional end-to-end (simulation to Mission Command Systems (MCS)) training functionality using TRADOC Proponent OfficeConstructive (TPO-C) low overhead simulations and TRADOC Proponent OfficeVirtual & Gaming (TPO-V&G) games. Simulations and tools such as Army Games for Training (GFT), Virtual Battle Space (VBS), and Division eXercise Training and Review System (DXTRS) are employed to enhance staff training at the lower continuum of training thresholds with the purpose of enhancing Military Decision Making Process (MDMP) and staff training in each respective TRADOC Institutions training curriculum. Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:Shall be available between 08001700 hrs, Monday through Friday except Federal holidays or when the government facility is closed for administrative reasons.Provide assistance and support with the necessary resources for planning, preparation, setup, operation, troubleshooting of the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS hardware and software applications and functionality to support the following tasks:Preparation, setup and operation of the closed networks supporting the TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications.Preparation, setup and operation of the unclassified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the classified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the DIS component between applications.Provide exercise preparation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide exercise execution for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide unit database and scenario builds that includes planning, building, and loading, configuring and operating TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications/tools.MDMP preparation, setup and operation using TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS ToolsProvide end to end functional preparation, setup and operations from the simulation/tool to include the MCS.Provide terrain preparation, setup and operation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G terrain tools.Provide TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS troubleshooting expertise when technical and operational issues occur.When a TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS issue/deficiency is identified, troubleshoot a work-around and submit a Problem Trouble Report (PTR) to TPO-C using the PTR Tool located on the NSC SharePoint Site.Provide support to all simulations in support of other exercises, training events, and planning.Provide support to LVC-G and other simulations, as requested.Serve as a systems and network administrator. This task includes all computer and network functions and infrastructure affecting the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS tools.Develop and provide written records (meetings, conference, working groups, after action reports, etc.) for each supported exercise/event.Provide testing and validation support to the capability and material development of the TPO-C tools.Provide operational and functional support of the MCS.Develop and provide briefing/presentation for each supported exercise/event as required by the OSCOR.Develop and provide Exercise Technical Summary Report for each supported exercise/event.When required, provide TPO-C and TPO-V&G support to other than COE/Schools.Provide computer networking support.Maintain training content; update the MilGaming web site and its content: graphics, animations, scenarios, models, terrain, training support packages (TSPs), and videos.Installation, Operation, and Maintenance of TPO-C and TPO-V&G Applications; this includes troubleshooting and resolving TPO-C and TPO-V&G software, hardware and network problem, real-time editing, and backup/recovery of all TPO-C and TPO-V&G data elements.Configuration Management; Maintain TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications. Manage version control and continuous integration, for all configuration management requirements.Install, Configure and operate existing and Emerging Army Stimulation-to- command and control (C2) interfaces; configure TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, and peripheral equipment to interface with Army Stimulation MCS interfaces as required.Administer the TPO-C and TPO-V&G systems during exercises and training events; participate in After Action Reviews (AARs) IAW TC 25-20, manage the TPO-C and TPO-V&G security compliance activities, to include the design and development of TPO-C and TPO-V&G information technology (IT) strategies at the local level.Maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G furnished equipment; maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, peripheral equipment, MCS equipment that may be issued by others and other simulation related items.Participate in required TPO-C and TPO-V&G /Mission Command Training Support Program (MCTSP) program review; participate in exercise readiness review, initial planning reviews, systems requirements reviews, software and hardware specification and design reviews, and participates in TPO-C and TPO-V&G user conferences/developer working groups.Instruct training audience and personnel to operate TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS systems and tools. Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree or experience equivalent in technical disciplines such as engineering, mathematics, statistics, and related computer sciences in performing capability development and Repair and Maintenance (RandM) tasks.Four years' experience in software development, simulation integration within the Microsoft Windows and Linux family of operating systems; to include expertise in hardware and software standards and protocols; ability to apply architectures to real world requirements using current Live, Virtual, Constructive and Gaming (LVC-G) platforms.Two years of experience in software testing, analysis, troubleshooting, problem trouble reports development, management and documentation (PTRs), and operating current gaming suite toolkit.Shall have the ability to write programs using C++, MFC, C#, Visual Basic, JAVA, XML, scripting languages, X programming and libraries and shall integrate networking packet protocols into simulation environments.Experience in providing technical advice for gaming development as it relates to the (LVC-G) Training Environment.Must be able to read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.Bachelor's degree or equivalent, any discipline, and three (3) years' experience in operating simulations, simulators, models, games and MCS.In lieu of a college degree, four (4) years' experience in database management and/or systems management on systems within JLCCTC, GFT and MCS may be substituted for a bachelor's degree. Clearance: Requires a Secret clearance Location: National Simulation Center, Fort Leavenworth, KS / Fort Liberty, NC / JBSA, TX / Fort Novosel, AL / Fort Sill, OK / Fort Moore, GA / Fort Leonard Wood, MO / Fort Gordon, GA / Fort Gregg-Adams, VA / Fort Bliss, TX / Fort Jackson, SC / Fort Huachuca, AZ / Carlisle Barracks, PA / Charlottesville, VA / West Point, NY / Monterey Bay, CA Travel: Travel may be required MTCCS II_Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer_Questionnaire, 27 AUG 2023Do you possess a Secret security clearance? title: Software Development Engineer/Radio Frequency with Security Clearance
job_description: Torch Technologies is seeking a Software Development Engineer (with Radio Frequency knowledge and/or experience) to join our team developing and implementing digital signal processing of Ultra-Wide Bandwidth software defined radio systems. This position supports PEO Aviation, PM Aviation Mission Systems and Architecture (AMSA). Responsibilities:This position requires a highly motivated individual with knowledge of digital signal processing and experience working with complex Radio Frequency systems across many different platforms.Generate software development roadmaps/strategies and cost estimates for Radio Frequency intensive systems.Capable of performing test and evaluation engineering of Radio Frequency systemsOversee and define requirements for software development activities associated with Radio Frequency signal collection and analysis.Evaluate emerging technologies and standards for use in Software Defined Radio systems.Perform countermeasures and vulnerability analysis for Radio Frequency systems.Experience integrating and troubleshooting complex hardware/software intensive systems.Experience modeling and using modeling tools (using CAMEO)Support implementation and development of digital signal processing of Ultra-Wide Bandwidth software defined radio (SDR) systems utilizing open standards such as VITA 49.2 and SOSA and define guidance for future development and standardization.Experience developing technical reports and presentations; must have the ability to work independently and effectively in a multi-disciplinary team environment. Job Requirements Required Qualifications:Bachelor's or Master's degree in computer science, or in an Engineering discipline.5-10 years' experienceGPU/GPGPU programming experienceAbility to obtain and maintain a DoD Clearance.U.S. Citizenship required. Preferred Qualifications:A field-programmable gate array development experience (Very High-Speed Integrated Circuit Hardware Description Language)Radio Frequency Systems of Chip (SoC) development experienceFamiliarity with VITA 49.2 or Modular Open Radio Frequency Architecture (MORA)Experience with design and/or testing of Radio Frequency devices and communication systems.Experience developing systems for military applications (e.g. avionics, GPS, Communications)Familiarity with communication protocols used in military Radio Frequency communication systems.Experience with developing countermeasures against Radio Frequency communications systems (jamming, spoofing, replay attacks, etc.)Familiarity working with test and measurement equipment such as spectrum analyzers and logic analyzers.Familiarity with security features associated with Radio Frequency communication systems.Experience with airworthiness qualification of hardware and software avionics components. U.S. Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes Job Type: Full Time Security Clearance: Secret Schedule: Minimum of 2 days a week on-site, with telework potential on other days Work Location: Redstone Arsenal, Alabama Travel: 10% Relocation Assistance Available: No Position Contingent Upon Award of Contract: No Benefits: Torch Technologies is proud to offer a stable and professional work environment, a competitive salary, and an excellent, comprehensive benefit package including ESOP participation, 401(k) match and safe-harbor contribution, medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, long-term disability, flexible spending accounts, Health Saving Accounts and Health Reimbursement Accounts, EAP, education assistance, paid time off, and holidays. title: 2024-05 Software IV&V Engineer/Analyst with Security Clearance
job_description: 1st Edge is a growing business seeking top performers to join in our mission of developing software solutions for our Government customers. We offer technically advanced, challenging work in an employee-centered environment driven by the desire to contribute to a meaningful purpose. Our employees work closely with Space and Missile Defense Command (SMDC), Missile Defense Agency (MDA), and Combat Capabilities Development Command (CCDC). We believe in a balanced, quid pro quo relationship between the company and its employees, providing all benefits at no cost, plus generous time off. This balanced culture allows employees to do their best work and contributes to our extraordinary success rate. From an excellent benefits package to job autonomy with challenging work, 1st Edge cultivates an innovative and collaborative environment with meaningful work. Job Description 1st Edge is seeking an advanced software engineer / analyst to plan and execute Independent Verification and Validation (IV&V) of tactical software for the Missile Defense Agency (MDA) Terminal High Altitude Area Defense (THAAD) System.The software engineer / analyst will be a member of a multi-disciplinary team that supports the THAAD Program Office with executing the software IV&V, firmware IV&V, and software assurance program. The place of performance is in Huntsville, AL. The successful candidate will have knowledge of software IV&V static and dynamic testing approaches and will have the ability to communicate effectively within our team.IV&V approaches include: decomposing existing source code using requirements, design and test documents; writing test and data capture frameworks to fully exercise the code under test; evaluating software using static analysis tools and eyes on code inspection; analyzing results from static analysis tools; recommending fixes and improvements to code; providing management with software health metrics; establishing/documenting robust IV&V processes; writing scripts to automate and streamline IV&V processes; collecting and analyzing test coverage data; and tracing system requirements from specifications, to design, to code and unit test. Leadership opportunities are available at the intermediate and advanced levels. Requires US citizenship and must possess and be able to maintain a SECRET level security clearance. Qualifications * Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science, or related discipline * 5-10 years of related software experience * Computer Languages: C++, Java * Operating Systems: Windows, Linux * Knowledge of dynamic and static testing techniques for IV&V * Familiarity with operating in a DevSecOps environment * Ability to work independently, demonstrate initiative, and organize all tasking * Good communication skills (oral and written) All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. However, please note, based on the requirements of our Government contracts, you must be a U.S. citizen to apply for this position.

title: Engineer for Acquisition of Software for Munitions with Security Clearance
job_description: Engineer for Acquisition of Software for Munitions Position Description CGI is seeking an Engineer in support of the Software Missile Branch of the Software Division of the Engineering Directorate, Strategic and Operational Rockets and Missiles (STORM) Project Office. The position requires an energetic professional with a strong software engineering background, previous software management experience, strong communication, problem solving and organizational skills. Performs studies, analysis, or evaluations of DoD weapon systems/equipment. This position does not involve the development of software but provides oversite and management in the acquisition process of a software product. Your future duties and responsibilities The support of the acquisition process for munition related products for STORM launchers. Leverages knowledge of software development process and systems process, use of Microsoft Project in the assessment of developed software schedules and the review of subsequent documentation Oversite and management of integration testing with STORM launchers, apply risk management tools to assess development and performance risks Support to Budget Analysts in cost determinations for tactical software projects Support all levels of staff including peers, team members, management, and customer. Support test team and fielding team members on a technical basis to ensure that they provide correct solution to the operational users. Responsible for tracking and reporting software deficiencies identified by operational users according to the projects processes and procedures. Required qualifications to be successful in this role Bachelors' and 10 years of experience is required. Understand and apply the Software Development Lifecycle and the acquisitions lifecycle to include Agile methodology Strong oral and written communication skills Demonstrated ability to work effectively with others Must be a self-starter which requires minimal supervision. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with CGI's legal duty to furnish information.

title: Sr. Software Engineer - Aircraft Survivability Equipment - 17180 with Security Clearance
job_description: Requisition Number: 17180 Required Travel: 0 - 10% Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt Security Clearance: Interim Secret Level of Experience: Mid This opportunity resides with Live, Virtual, Constructive Solutions, a business group within HII's Mission Technologies division. As a trusted partner to our military customers, we design, develop and operate systems that bring together service members from across the globe to help you train like you fight, because we understand that preparation requires full coordination-not readiness in piece parts. Meet HII's Mission Technologies Division Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense - the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Our capabilities range from C5ISR, AI and Big Data, cyber operations and synthetic training environments to fleet sustainment, environmental remediation and the largest family of unmanned underwater vehicles in every class. Find the role that's right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you. Summary HII Mission Technologies is seeking a Software Engineer to develop and field world-class aircraft survivability systems against continually evolving threats for PM Aircraft Survivability Equipment (ASE). ASE is an array of electronic devices, systems, and countermeasures designed to reduce an aircraft's susceptibility and vulnerability to threats. Selected candidate will design, develop, document, test and debug applications software and systems that contain logical and mathematical solutions. Conduct multidisciplinary research and collaborates with equipment designers and/or hardware engineers in the planning, design, development, and utilization of electronic data processing systems for product and commercial software. Then determine computer user needs; analyzes system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls; prepares operating instructions; designs and develops compilers and assemblers, utility programs, and operating systems. to ensure software standards are met. What you will do * Perform requirements analysis, design, code, unit test, and integration test for systems to detect, alert, and mitigate aircraft threats Lead and mentor the team on DevSecOps, PM ASE Software Development Process, industry best practices, lessons learned, and the US Army's Airworthiness Release (AWR) Process Develop, compile, and review Software Design Review (SDR), Preliminary Design Review (PDR), Critical Design Review (CDR), Test Readiness Review (TRR), Formal Qualification Review (FQR), and other deliverables Develop systems to perform Formal Qualification Tests (FQT), System Integration Tests (SIT), System Performance Tests (SPT) and Design Verification Tests (DVT) Develop, install, configure, and maintain the Software Development Environment Use Agile and daily SCRUM meetings to track progress and report issues Use Change Requests (CR), Configuration Control Boards (CCB), and software repositories for Configuration Management (CM) Brief program status and technical requirements to senior leadership, stakeholders, and team membersWhat you must have * Must have 9 years relevant experience with Bachelors in related field display attention to details and ability to follow processes and procedures Must have experience developing software in C++ Must have experience working with Agile, SCRUM, and DevSecOps Must have experience with secure coding and integrating cyber security into the Software Development Process Must have excellent documentation and communications skills to include code comments, software designs, git commits, merge requests, and API documentation Must have experience with Microsoft Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook) Must have great verbal and written communication skills to present technical information to clients, stakeholders, and team members Must have ability to obtain and maintain an active DoD Secret security clearance, start date contingent upon obtaining an interim DoD Secret security Must be a U.S. CitizenPreferred Requirements * Current or active DoD Secret security clearance or higher preferred. * Experience with git, Gitlab, and Confluence Experience with Modular Open Source Architecture (MOSA) Experience with Future Airborne Capability Environment (FACE)Physical Requirements Adequate visual acuity and manual dexterity for meeting the requirements Software Engineer family. This position is in an office with lab environment. Lifting and moving materials may be required. Why HII We build the world's most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our diverse workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals. Recognized as one of America's top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people's safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you'll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career. Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive. Today's challenges are bigger than ever, and the nation needs the best of us. It's why we're focused on hiring, developing and nurturing our diversity. We believe that diversity among our workforce strengthens the organization, stimulates creativity, promotes the exchange of ideas and enriches the work lives of all our employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. Do You Need Assistance? If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 1-844-849-8463 for assistance. Press #3 for HII Technical Solutions.

title: GMD Weapons System (GWS)- Mechanical (Structural) Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Number 662925BR Description:What We're DoingAs a part of the Lockheed Martin community, we take on challenges and find solutions using creativity and collaboration. If you're looking to be a part of a passionate team solving these complex problems, then Rotary and Mission Systems is the place for you. The Work Become a part of something meaningful! Ground Missile Defense (GMD) is the heart of the Missile Defense System and a key element of our nation's defense against ballistic missile attacks. The GMD Weapon System processes data from multiple sensors to identify and characterize the inbound ballistic missile threat, plans the best defensive solution, and launches the intercepting missiles to negate the threat. We're looking for a Mechanical Engineer with an emphasis on Structural Engineering experience to join the GWS A&D Hardware Team. As a Structural Engineer you will support the GMD Weapon System (GWS)Hardware Engineering team's design efforts working within an Agile environment. Your core tasks will entail evaluating structural design solutions via analysis for multiple Ground Systems (GS) IPT hardware systems and their structural interfaces with facilities. Under the direction of your product line owner, responsibilities include performing structural analyses IAW industry and military standards, evaluating structural hardware design efforts, scheduling, and planning required tasks, leading small teams, and writing reports to support milestone reviews. Accountability and active participation in team scrum meetings and internal/external demos, and documenting progress on team dashboards is expected. Who We AreLockheed Martin is a global aerospace, defense, and security company dedicated to advancing scientific discovery and harnessing innovation to make the world a safer place. Our RMS business in Huntsville, AL is a hub of talented engineers, scientists, and professionals committed to shaping the future of defense technology. We value collaboration, excellence, and integrity in everything we do. As a part of our team, you will work alongside like-minded individuals dedicated to pushing the boundaries of what's possible. Learn more about IWSS Why Join Us Your Health, Your Wealth, Your Life Our flexible schedules, competitive pay and comprehensive benefits enable you to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. Learn more about Lockheed Martin's comprehensive benefits package here! #rmshotmiljobs GMDLI0324Basic Qualifications BS in Mechanical, Aerospace or Civil Engineering and minimum 5 Years of Experience Or 3 Years of experience and a Masters' degree within a STEM field Current active US DoD Secret Security clearance Prior experience with the design, test, and/or integration and deployment of mechanical and structural components, systems, or subsystems Understanding and application of industry engineering technical standards; demonstrated structural design experience and impact assessment. Must be able to support an in-person / closed-area work environment full time. Requirements-driven structural hardware design, test, and evaluation Experience with Finite Element Analysis and Modeling theory and application using industry standard structural analysis software (ANSYS, GTStrudl, ABAQUS, STAAD, Femap, NX Simcenter, NASTRAN, Creo Simulation or SolidWorks Simulation) Experience performing static structural analysis of composite or metallic parts. Experience performing dynamic structural analysis of composite or metallic parts (modal, shock, vibration, transient loading) Experience in writing technical reports, test procedures, and specifications. Experience in one or more of the following system engineering knowledge areas: technical planning, requirements derivation, functional analysis,timeline analysis, trade studies, cost and risk analysis, interface definition, system design, system integration, verification and validation, supportability, and effectiveness analyses for total systems. SolidWorks, NX and Teamcenter experience DOORS and/or CAMEO exposure Experience with classified test systems or systems subject to cyber security policies and risk management framework (RMF) Familiarity with MIL-STD-810, MIL-STD-1366, MIL-HDBK-1791, UFC 3-301-02, UFC 3-301-01, ASCE 7, ICC-ES AC 156 Ability to communicate data in a clear and concise manner. Experience leading a small team, including task and schedule planning, to meet major project milestone objectives. Experience in Agile Development Ability to show self as self-starter, team player, able to multi-task, able to generate quality work products independently, able to make excellent judgement and show interpersonal skills. Ability to travel at least 10%Desired Skills Generate engineering documentation including technical drawings, specifications, and test reports. Mentoring and cross-training junior engineers in analysis work, reviews, and approving their analysis results to meet customer requirements. Experience using analytical software tools, such as MATLAB or Python, to analyze and reduce data to identify key characteristics and trends. Experience with mission critical and safety critical systems, components, etc. Familiarity with Missile Defense Agency (MDA) Core Standards: MDA-QS-001-MAP, MDA-QS-003-PMAP, MDA Instruction 5000.20-INS (ETR Process) Familiarity with the GMD domain and GMD Launch Support Systems hardware PE License in Civil/Structural EngineeringSecurity Clearance Statement: This position requires a government security clearance, you must be a US Citizen for consideration.Clearance Level: SecretOther Important Information You Should KnowExpression of Interest: By applying to this job, you are expressing interest in this position and could be considered for other career opportunities where similar skills and requirements have been identified as a match. Should this match be identified you may be contacted for this and future openings.Ability to Work Remotely: Onsite Full-time: The work associated with this position will be performed onsite at a designated Lockheed Martin facility.Work Schedules: Lockheed Martin supports a variety of alternate work schedules that provide additional flexibility to our employees. Schedules range from standard 40 hours over a five day work week while others may be condensed. These condensed schedules provide employees with additional time away from the office and are in addition to our Paid Time off benefits.Schedule for this Position: 9x80 every other Friday offLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.The application window will close in 90 days; applicants are encouraged to apply within 5 - 30 days of the requisition posting date in order to receive optimal consideration.At Lockheed Martin, we use our passion for purposeful innovation to help keep people safe and solve the world's most complex challenges. Our people are some of the greatest minds in the industry and truly make Lockheed Martin a great place to work. With our employees as our priority, we provide diverse career opportunities designed to propel, develop, and boost agility. Our flexible schedules, competitive pay, and comprehensive benefits enable our employees to live a healthy, fulfilling life at and outside of work. We place an emphasis on empowering our employees by fostering an inclusive environment built upon integrity and corporate responsibility. If this sounds like a culture you connect with, you're invited to apply for this role. Or, if you are unsure whether your experience aligns with the requirements of this position, we encourage you to search on Lockheed Martin Jobs , and apply for roles that align with your qualifications.Experience Level: Experienced ProfessionalBusiness Unit: RMSRelocation Available: PossibleCareer Area: Mechanical EngineeringType: Full-TimeShift: First

title: Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Duties GS-0801/0806/0830/0840/0850/0854/0855/0861/0893/0896Performs (general, material, computer, mechanical, electrical, electronics, aerospace) engineering tasks of limited scope and difficulty which are screened by a higher-grade engineer.Performs general engineering work of limited scope and complexity in support of projects assigned to higher grade engineers.Uses engineering manuals, standard publications and technical material to obtain information and pertinent data to be used by higher level engineers, contractors and/or customers.Keep abreast of emerging technologies and professional development to maintain current in the field and for application to work assignments. GS-0858Uses professional knowledge of biomedical engineering to perform difficult, but well-precedented assignments which are normally minor phases of a broader project assigned to a higher-grade engineer.Participates with senior personnel in planning, monitoring, and conducting special studies, projects, and initiatives. * uses computer/computer software such as information management programs, computer aided design and drafting (CADD) programs, and tracking programs to assist senior personnel in solving engineering or scientific problems and facilitate the work.Uses engineering manuals, standards publications and technical material to obtain information and pertinent data to be used by higher level engineers, contractors and/or customers. Requirements Conditions of EmploymentPlease read this Public Notice in its entirety prior to submitting your application for consideration.U.S. Citizenship is requiredMales must be registered for Selective Service, see www.sss.govTotal salary varies depending on location of positionPCS expenses if authorized will be paid IAW JTR and Air Force RegulationsRecruitment incentives may be authorizedThis posn is subject to provisions of the DoD Priority Placement ProgramSome position may be subject to drug testingEmployee must maintain current certificationsDisclosure of Political AppointmentsYou will be required to serve a one year probationary periodSome position under this announcement may require secret or top secret clearance Qualifications BASIC REQUIREMENTS for GS-7 and GS-9: A. Degree: Professional engineering. To be acceptable, the curriculum must: (1) be in a school of engineering with at least one curriculum accredited by the Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET) as a professional engineering curriculum; or (2) include differential and integral calculus and courses (more advanced than first-year physics and chemistry) in five of the following seven areas of engineering science or physics: (a) statics, dynamics; (b) strength of materials (stress-strain relationships); (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics; (d) thermodynamics;(e) electrical fields and circuits; (f) nature and properties of materials (relating particle and aggregate structure to properties; and (g) any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, soil mechanics, or electronics. OR B. Combination of education and experience--College-level education, training, and/or technical experience that furnished (1) a thorough knowledge of the physical and mathematical sciences underlying professional engineering, and (2) a good understanding, both theoretical and practical, of the engineering sciences and techniques and their applications to one of the branches of engineering. You may qualify if you meet one of the following:GS-7: You must have completed a 4 year course of study leading to a bachelor's from an accredited institution AND must have documented Superior Academic Achievement (SAA) or one year of specialized experience equivalent to at least a GS-05 at the undergraduate level in one of the following: a) Class Standing - upper third of the graduating class based on completed courses in the college, university, or major subdivision; b) Grade Point Average - 2.95 or higher out of a possible 4.0 as recorded on your official transcript or as computed based on 4 years of education or as computed based on courses completed during the final 2 years of curriculum; OR 3.45 or higher out of a possible 4.0 based on the average of the required courses completed in your major field or the required courses in your major field completed during the final 2 years of your curriculum. If more than 10 percent of total undergraduate credit hours are non-graded, i.e. pass/fail, CLEP, CCAF, DANTES, military credit, etc, you cannot qualify based on GPA; c) Election to membership in a national scholastic honor society (note: freshman honor society cannot be used to meet the requirements of this position). (If qualifying based on class standing or honor society membership, provide appropriate documentation). ORYou have one full year (18 semester hours or the equivalent) of graduate level study, or possess a master's or higher degree, e.g., LL.B., J.D., LL.M., Ph.D., in a field that provided the knowledge, skills, and abilities to do the work of this position. Such fields include business administration, industrial management, industrial engineering, industrial psychology, public administration, political science, or government.(Submit copy of transcripts). ORYou have at least one year (12 months) of specialized experience, that provided knowledge of to perform successfully the duties of the position. To be creditable, specialized experience must have been equivalent to at least the next lower qualifying pay band or equivalent grade under the General Schedule (GS) or other pay systems. Equivalent experience may be at the level of the lowest GS grade covered by the applicable pay band; however, the experience must demonstrate KSA's to successfully perform the duties of the position being filled. ORYou must have a combination of graduate education as described above and the type of specialized experience as described above, which when combined would equate to 100%. (To compute, first determine your total qualifying graduate level education as a percentage of the graduate education required; then determine your total qualifying experience as a percentage of experience described above; add the two percentages. The total percentage must equal to at least 100 %.) (Submit a copy of your transcript.) KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES (KSAs): Your qualifications will be evaluated on the basis of your level of knowledge, skills, abilities and/or competencies in the following areas: GS-0801/0806/0830/0840/0850/0854/0855/0861/0893/0896Performs general engineering tasks of limited scope and difficulty which are screened by a higher-grade engineer. Some knowledge of work processes, and the capability to apply standard general engineering practices, required to directly apply varied rules, procedures and precedents to the assignments.Performs engineering work of limited scope and complexity in support of projects assigned to higher grade engineers. Plans work procedures and selects standard practices and data to be applied to work projects and identified problems. Uses accepted engineering work processes to search for information to bear on a problem and recognizes situations which may require referral to others.Uses engineering manuals, standard publications and technical material to obtain information pertinent data to be used by higher level engineers, contractors and /or customers.Keeps abreast of emerging technologies and professional developments to maintain current in the field and for application to work assignments. Uses computers/computer software such as analysis tools and project tracking programs to solve engineering problems and facilitate work. GS-0858Professional knowledge of biomedical engineering concept, theories, and principles and standard engineering practices, methods, and techniques to perform difficult, but well-precedented assignments which are normally minor phases of a larger project.Knowledge of automated technology and practices used to prepare engineering designs/drawings.Skill in analyzing problems, identifying significant factors, gathering and interpreting pertinent data, and applying established rules and procedures in order to recommend solutions.Skill in gathering and interpreting pertinent data, preparing recommendations, and making calculations by applying standard formulas; preparing graphs, curves, or tables; and recording factual data or information from studies.Ability to communicate clearly, concisely, and with technical accuracy, both orally and in writing, as well as work in a professional manner with peers and management.Ability to learn and apply analytical investigate techniques to accomplish work in the subject-matter field. PART-TIME OR UNPAID EXPERIENCE: Credit will be given for appropriate unpaid and or part-time work. You must clearly identify the duties and responsibilities in each position held and the total number of hours per week. VOLUNTEER WORK EXPERIENCE: Refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service Programs (i.e., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community; student and social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge and skills that can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience. Education This position has an education requirement. You MUST provide transcripts to support your educational claims. Education must be accredited by an accrediting institution recognized by the U.S. Department of Education. http://www2.ed.gov/admins/finaid/accred/index.html Please submit copies of all Transcripts to include Transferred hours - Official copies are not required at time of application. title: O.T. Systems Manager
job_description: Company ProfileDiversified Gas & Oil Corporation (“DGOC”) is a wholly-owned subsidiary of Diversified Energy Company PLC, a US-based company listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) and London Stock Exchange (LSE) under the ticker symbol “DEC”. Diversified Gas & Oil Corporation (DGOC) is an established owner and operator of producing conventional and unconventional natural gas & oil wells and midstream pipelines and compression stations concentrated in the Appalachian Basin in the United States. Headquartered in Birmingham, AL, our field operations are located throughout the Appalachian Basin in the states of Tennessee, Kentucky, Virginia, West Virginia, Ohio, and Pennsylvania. In 2021, Diversified announced our expansion into our Central Regional Focus Area, which includes producing areas within Louisiana, Texas, Oklahoma, and Arkansas.Position Summary & Responsibilities** Desired location is Birmingham, Alabama. Remote may be an option for the right candidate. **We require a technical hands-on leader. This position will provide technical leadership, operational support, administration, and project leadership of all assigned business systems, and various OT applications/databases including Wellview, Siteview, SROD, SNAP, PDS, ARIES, Gemini, AGERE, and Iconic Air as well as others that may be assigned to OT as we evolve. The understanding and use of technologies, networking, applications is critical to success in this role.This role will be part of a team that reports to the Director of Operational Technology (OT). We service over 1500 employees, dozens of applications, and thousands of endpoints. Our service area covers nine states currently supported by an array of employees and managed service partners.Special focus will be placed on:Operational SkillsetsApp and integration - troubleshoot application issues and maintain database interfaces across various applications.Data requests - extract information for users over and beyond the out of box report functionality.Identify technical problems and work to resolve the issue.Root cause analysis troubleshooting.Testing and coordination of scheduled application maintenance, releases, and major version upgrades.Execute, monitor, and validate system upgrades including application, operating system, and related dependencies.Optimize and tune system performance, performing maintenance activities as required.Experience and a preference to manage operational work using tickets.Champion of change management, user acceptance testing, and validations.Balance and manage the complexities of licensing obligations with application administration and support.Ability to be productive working between application and cloud infrastructure teams.Collaboration with other IT and business subject matter experts to administer, support, and maintain technical solutions.Engineering SkillsetsSeek to understand company data sources.Ability to reverse engineer existing solutions and be accountable for current state implementations.Automation skillset in one or more languages. Experience automating routine or mundane activities.Analyze and identify software or hardware systemic problems and work with the appropriate teams or vendors to create a solution to resolve the issue and engineer out the probability of it becoming a further problem.Independent research - the ability to dig into previous tickets, emails, documents, to research past solutions.Architecture SkillsetsCreate detailed and abstract technical drawings and comprehensive system documentation (PPT, Visio).Business analysis skills. Ability to document swim lanes, data flow diagrams, and business process mapping.Ability to correlate and translate business needs to technical solutions.Ability to communicate recommendations effectively and propose changes.Implement and maintain application configuration database.Position RequirementsBachelor’s degree in computer information systems or a related combination of education and experience.Understanding of common oil and gas business processes.Advanced capability to write SQL queries, manage ETL/API processes, and complex system integrations. Experience at creating SQL objects: stored procedures, triggers, rules, views, and user defined data types or functions.One or more language skills: T-SQL, PL/SQL, Python, or PowerShell.Ability to map system processes and create entity relationship diagrams.Expertise in one more of the following systems: SharePoint Online, SQL, ESRI, Aries, WellView/SiteView,Willingness to provide after-hours support when required.Desire to help others achieve success, interfaces well with others, and keen to assist and learn about areas outside assigned responsibilities.Ownership and accountability. Identify the problem and own it. Self-starter with a strong desire to deliver superior results.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to prioritize concurrent and competing priority assignments.Excellent interpersonal and written/verbal communication skills. Travel Expectation:Travel will vary, expect 5% - 15% depending on business needs but no set expectation, travel as required to manage/build business relationships.

title: Network Engineer, Senior with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Number: R0182883 Network Engineer, SeniorThe Opportunity: A well-designed network is critical to move data and enable law enforcement to achieve their mission, but how can an organization make sure their network will fit their current and evolving needs? Crafting the right network, with the right equipment and sof tware, requires a combination of te chn ical skill and careful planning. That's why we need you, a network engineer who knows how to craft the exact network law enforcement needs. As a network engineer, you will be supporting law enforcement by managing, monitoring, and enhancing local and wide area network systems, including planning designing, evaluating, selecting, and upgrading operating systems and protocol suites, and communications media with concentrators, bridges, and other network devices. Additionally, you will help resolve interoperability problems to obtain operations across all platforms, performance testing and documentation, administration of networks, configuration management, and provide input on acquisitions and design layout, as requested. Join us. The world can't wait. You Have: * 8+ years of experience in Network Engineering Experience with Cisco platforms and tools, including Prime, ISE, or Nexus Experience with Cisco Routers and Switches IOS, IOS XE, or Nexus XE Experience with planning, designing, and executing network hardware infrastructure installations Experience with troubleshooting network connectivity issues Top Secret clearance HS diploma or GED and 12+ years of experience with network engineering, or Bachelor's degree and 8+ years of experience with network engineering Nice If You Have: * Knowledge of routing, switching, firewalls, and int rus ion detection or prevention te chn ologies * Knowledge of network management tools, including What's Up Gold, Nagios, or MRTG * Possession of excellent verbal and written communication skills * Bachelor's degree in Information Systems Te chn ology, Computer Science, or Engineering Clearance: Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information ; Top Secret clearance is required. Create Your Career: Grow With Us Your growth matters to us-that's why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs , tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms. A Place Where You Belong Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen's culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you'll develop your community in no time. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we'll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life-at work and at home. Here, we've compiled a list of resources so you'll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us. title: Senior Reliability & System Safety Engineer (Engineer Systems 4) with Security Clearance
job_description: Requisition Number: 17760 Required Travel: 0 - 10% Employment Type: Full Time/Salaried/Exempt Security Clearance: Ability to Obtain Level of Experience: Senior HI This opportunity resides with Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Cyber, Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (C5ISR), a business group within HII's Mission Technologies division. From towers to processors, we design, develop, integrate and manage the sensors, systems and other assets necessary to support integrated intelligence, surveillance and reconnaissance (ISR) operations, exploitation and analysis for the Intelligence Community, the military services, geographic and functional combatant commands and DoD agencies. Meet HII's Mission Technologies Division Our team of more than 7,000 professionals worldwide delivers all-domain expertise and advanced technologies in service of mission partners across the globe. Mission Technologies is leading the next evolution of national defense - the data evolution - by accelerating a breadth of national security solutions for government and commercial customers. Our capabilities range from C5ISR, AI and Big Data, cyber operations and synthetic training environments to fleet sustainment, environmental remediation and the largest family of unmanned underwater vehicles in every class. Find the role that's right for you. Apply today. We look forward to meeting you. Summary HII-Mission Technologies is seeking a motivated Senior Systems Engineer in Huntsville, AL to help support the C5ISR Systems operation. Our team is growing and offers the opportunity to solve challenges that require the experience and expertise of an engineer ready to help deliver more reliable, maintainable, safe, supportable, and affordable systems. We are called upon to support projects across the United States DoD Services (e.g., Army, Marine Corps, Navy, Air Force, Space Force, Coast Guard, and National Guard) and across a diverse array of air, land, sea, and space systems. Learn from and collaborate with our experts that have been at the forefront of RMQSI since 1968 as we directly contributed to and continue to contribute to the development of DoD standards, handbooks, policies, training, and other guides. Our employees have incredible opportunities to work on mission critical systems that impact people's lives today and tomorrow. Come join our team and make tangible improvements to the reliability, maintainability, supportability, safety, and affordability of systems that protect our warfighters from air, ground, and maritime threats and enhance situational awareness. What You Will Do * Performs reliability, maintainability, supportability, and system safety analyses for components, assemblies, subsystems, and systems across mechanical, electrical, and software devices. Performs analyses across all phases of system life cycle to include: concept, design, development, fabrication, test, installation, operation, maintenance, and disposal. Applies design for reliability, maintainability, supportability, and system safety principles. Ensures the logical and systematic conversion of customer or product requirements into total life cycle systems management solutions that balance technical, schedule, and cost constraints. Collaborates with colleagues to perform allocation; prediction; block diagrams and modeling; Failure Reporting, Analysis, and Corrective Action System (FRACAS); Failure Modes, Effects, and Criticality Analysis (FMECA); Fault Tree Analysis (FTA); R&M tests and demonstration; reliability growth planning; Reliability Centered Maintenance Analysis (RCMA); Maintenance Task Analysis (MTA); Level of Repair Analysis (LORA); sparing analysis; hazard analysis; system safety planning; and associated trade studies to translate customer requirements into hardware and software specifications. Participates in engineering meetings and program reviews to advocate for RMQSI and/or system safety in engineering trade-off process. Offer working familiarity with applicable DoD and commercial standards, policies, and guides related to development and lifecycle support programs, RMQSI, and system safety.What You Will Do * 9 years of relevant experience with Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics (STEM) field; 7 years of relevant experience with Masters in STEM field; 4 years of experience with PhD or Juris Doctorate in STEM field; or High School Diploma or equivalent and 15 years of relevant experience. Familiar with: * DoD acquisition, policies, guides, etc. Use of common reliability software, such as ReliaSoft, Relex/PTC Windchill, Isograph, and Relyence. Possession of strong initiative and interpersonal skills, including writing detailed reports and effectively preparing and giving presentations. Must be able to work both independently and with a team to execute work tasks in a rapidly changing, fast-paced environmentPreferred: Bonus Points For * D Active DoD Secret Clearance Familiar with Model-Based Engineering and development of digital twins to perform M&S of RMQSI and system safety capabilities. Recognized as an American Society for Quality (ASQ) Certified Reliability Engineer (CRE) and/or Society for Maintenance and Reliability Professional (SMRP) Certified Maintenance & Reliability Professional (CMRP).Why HII We build the world's most powerful, survivable naval ships and defense technology solutions that safeguard our seas, sky, land, space and cyber. Our diverse workforce includes skilled tradespeople; artificial intelligence, machine learning (AI/ML) experts; engineers; technologists; scientists; logistics experts; and business administration professionals. Recognized as one of America's top large company employers, we are a values and ethics driven organization that puts people's safety and well-being first. Regardless of your role or where you serve, at HII, you'll find a supportive and welcoming environment, competitive benefits, and valuable educational and training programs for continual career growth at every stage of your career. Together we are working to ensure a future where everyone can be free and thrive. Today's challenges are bigger than ever, and the nation needs the best of us. It's why we're focused on hiring, developing and nurturing our diversity. We believe that diversity among our workforce strengthens the organization, stimulates creativity, promotes the exchange of ideas and enriches the work lives of all our employees. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, physical or mental disability, age, or veteran status or any other basis protected by federal, state, or local law. Do You Need Assistance? If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please send an e-mail to and let us know the nature of your request and your contact information. Reasonable accommodations are considered on a case-by-case basis. Please note that only those inquiries concerning a request for reasonable accommodation will be responded to from this email address. Additionally, you may also call 1-844-849-8463 for assistance. Press #3 for HII Technical Solutions.

title: Mechanical Engineer

title: Senior Missile System Engineer/Analyst with Security Clearance
job_description: Willbrook Solutions, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity EmployerEOE AA M/F/Vet/DisabilityJob Requisition Number: 3316469Job Title: Senior Missile System Engineer/AnalystLabor Location: Huntsville, AL JOB DESCRIPTION:ResponsibilitiesWillbrook Solutions is seeking a Senior Missile System Engineer/Analyst to support of the Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA) and perform intelligence data evaluation, analysis, and design for advanced conventional weapon systems. The candidate will work as part of a multi-discipline team to develop a comprehensive understanding, design, and assessment of foreign radar, missile, and command and control (C2) weapon systems. RESPONSIBILITIES & TASKS:Support the analysis of foreign missile's propulsion subsystem, guidance and navigation, RF or IIR seeker, airframe, and control subsystems using insights gained from intelligence data. Support the assessment of the theory of operation, characteristics and performance, physical characteristics, signatures, vulnerabilities, and employment of the weapon system. Support the development of digital models, simulations, and hardware representations of the missile system and computer-based analytical tools needed to assess system capabilities and vulnerabilities. Input parametric data, develop algorithms, and provide quality control of databases, for which the information shall be used for engineering and scientific assessments. REQUIRED SKILLS/EXPERIENCE:Must be U.S. citizenAbility to obtain and maintain a TOP SECRET clearanceBachelor's degree or higher in in Engineering, Physics, Data Analytics, or Mathematics from an ABET-accredited Program with at least 10 years experienceAble to perform exploratory analysis and research, and present results to both technical and non-technical audiences.Strong analytic, critical thinking, and creative problem-solving skillsEffective interpersonal skills including the ability to collaborate with experts from varied disciplines.Strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to clearly communicate in simple, easily understood terms. PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:Active TS/SCI clearanceIntel experience/backgroundExperience using C, C++, MATLAB, Python, Simulink, or other programming languages.Experience with foreign weapon systems, including advanced radars, missiles, or command and control (C2) systems SECURITY REQUIREMENTS:Ability to obtain and maintain a TOP SECRET clearance

title: Mid-Level Technical Data Analyst with Security Clearance
job_description: Torch Technologies Inc., is seeking a Mid-Level Technical Data Analyst that will support the Security Assistance Management Directorate (SAMD) International Program Manager (IPM) and perform a vast array of technical duties related to Air and Missile Defense systems for the HAWK Building Partner Capacity (BPC) program, to include project planning/analysis, program development, and financial and contracts related activities. He/she gathers, processes, and analyzes requests from International Partners to formulate operational data for execution. Additionally, the successful candidate will interface directly with government program managers, engineers, finance, contracts, and logistics, as part of a team in support of the HAWK program. The successful candidate will assist in the preparation of briefings and presentations to government working levels and senior government officials. The Technical Data Analyst will research material for country briefings, as well as preparing reports and memorandums. He/she will work on other projects as assigned and will secure information by completing data base backups. Technical Data Analyst will also provide historical reference by developing and utilizing filing and retrieval systems. He/she should demonstrate significant knowledge on utilization of Microsoft Office Products. Experience with HAWK or Patriot missile systems, and MS Project desired. The successful candidate will have prior HAWK, PATRIOT, or other Air Defense Missile System operations, maintenance, and training experience.
