title: Modular Open System Architecture (MOSA) Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Intrepid sets the standard for delivering excellence in the federal marketplace and is known for treating employees like family. We provide our employees with a challenging and supportive work environment, paired with a competitive salary and an industry-leading 401k contribution. We are looking for a Modular Open System Architecture (MOSA) Engineer to join our team to support the Future Long Range Assault Aircraft (FLRAA). THIS POSITION IS ELIGIBLE FOR A $3,000 SIGN-ON BONUS!! The Architecture Engineer will focus on the weapon system development architecture for the FLRAA PMO and will provide avionics architecture engineering support integrating the tenants of Modular Open System Architecture (MOSA) in new rotary wing aviation development program. Your day-to-day work will include:Supporting the FLRAA Project Office as a systems architecture engineer during the development of system/subsystem specifications, reference/system architectures, program briefings, white papers, and other products.Providing technical support in the development of FLRAA aircraft mission systems architectural design and development.Assisting in the design and implementation of short and long-term strategic goals for managing and maintaining systems and software.Developing architectural specification requirements and Performance Work Statements (PWS) based on FLRAA Modular Open System Approach (MOSA) business objectives and technical goals.Researching and identifying technology products required for solution delivery and assesses contractor provided proposals for technical merit.Establishing, implementing, and documenting the technology integration or migration strategies.Providing engineering review of all contractor's technical efforts, including S&T and IR&D, and represents the FLRAA Project Office during technical reviews covering mission system. At a minimum you should have:A Bachelor's degree in a Technical Field +15 years' experience or a master's degree in a Technical Field +12 years' experience.An active SECRET clearance or the ability to obtain and maintain.Experience with design, verification, and qualification of aviation systemsExperience in modular design, interface management, and open systems architectureKnowledge of Model Base Systems Engineering (MBSE) and SysML/UMLKnowledge of the Future Airborne Capability Environment (FACE) technical standardKnowledge with SAE ARP 4754/4761The ability to execute advanced, complex technical tasksTechnical knowledge of the industry trends and emerging technologies for system architectureThe ability to lead a working groupThe ability to complete high-priority projects under strict time constraintsStrong oral and written communication skillsThe ability to work effectively with others in a teaming environmentThe ability to work autonomouslyProficiency with Microsoft Office, Magic Draw, DOORS (or other traceability tools), and available SE tools. You will be highly desirable if you have:A MS degree in Systems Engineering DegreeA strong foundation in MOSA **This job description is subject to change at any time. Work Type: On-Site (Huntsville, AL) Work/Life at Intrepid Wondering what it's like to work here? Let us give you a glimpse of our exceptional workplace culture. Our employees have consistently nominated us for the Best Places to Work award and we take pride in our family-like environment, remarkable benefits, and go-the-extra-mile attitude. The Hours We sincerely value work-life balance. Our flexible-hours policy allows you to balance extra time during significant projects with days that are lighter. Moreover, we offer generous accrual of paid personal leave that doesn't lose its value (no use it or lose it here!) as well as 11 paid holidays per year. The Benefits Our benefits are renowned, starting with our outstanding 401k program. No match required! We contribute 14% of your bi-weekly pay to your account regardless of your contribution. With our low-fee index funds from Fidelity, your retirement savings will grow substantially. Plus, your professional financial advisors are already covered! Our top-notch health insurance plan through Blue Cross Blue Shield includes low deductibles ($200/year) and is mostly covered by Intrepid, or you can choose a high-deductible plan with an eligible HSA, the choice is yours! We also provide complimentary life insurance, affordable dental, vision, disability, critical illness, and pet insurance. Additionally, you can set aside pre-tax dollars for medical and dependent care expenses through an FSA. We even offer a $1000 scholarship for newborn or adopted children, as well as those enrolled in higher education. The Perks Enjoy typical perks like corporate discounts as well as unique experiences as an Intrepid employee. You'll be a VIP at our annual events, including the Chili Cook-Off, Thanksgiving Lunch & Lawn Games, Ice-Cream Social, Intrepig BBQ, and the grand end-of-year Christmas bash with amazing prizes! Remote workers have special virtual engagement opportunities and exclusive events so no one is left out of the fun. Give Back Giving back is ingrained in our values. Through our employee-managed charitable fund, the Intrepid Ideal Community Fund (ICF), we contribute tens of thousands of dollars each year to organizations that help people in need. Join us in various volunteer opportunities and help us make a difference in our communities. Our vision is to one day create ideal communities where every citizen's needs are met. Join Us! There's something for everyone at Intrepid. If our benefits, perks, values, and mission resonate with you, we're thrilled to meet you! Start your journey as an Intrepid employee by applying today. We can't wait to hear from you! About Intrepid: Intrepid is a VEVRAA Federal Contractor and an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to making employment decisions based on merit and value. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran. #CJ

title: Lead Systems Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: We are seeking a Lead Systems Software Engineer supporting the Advancing Operational Test Infrastructure (AOTI) effort. This effort is developing software capabilities for Operational Test Command to Plan, Prepare, Execute, and Assess Data across test event lifecycles. The person in this role will be responsible for leading and setting the tone for the program’s systems engineering efforts including (but not limited to) system design, high level architecture, interface definitions, and system behaviors. As a Lead Systems Software Engineer, you'll spearhead the program's systems engineering efforts, steering system design, high-level architecture, interface definitions, and system behaviors. Your role is pivotal in bridging the gap between technical and non-technical stakeholders, requiring effective communication and collaboration. What You'll Do: Your day-to-day activities include, but are not limited to: Lead and guide the AOTI program's engineering initiatives. Lead the Systems Engineering team in deriving requirements that guide the software development team to create the products to meet our customers' needs. Identify stakeholder, customer and user needs in conjunction with UX Research team to design new systems and/or improve existing systems to meet these needs. Conduct research to identify new technologies that could improve existing products or processes Lead and perform critical Systems Engineering activities such as requirements development, functional analysis, and technical documentation. Coordinate with program management personnel to prioritize programmatic and technical objectives. Implement Risk Management Processes by facilitating the Risk Management Board, coordinating risk assessments with stakeholders, maintaining mitigation action plans, and providing reports to inform leadership of current program risk posture on a regular basis. Apply Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) processes within standard toolsets in a manner that enables efficient and effective response to changing mission needs and rapidly evolving system requirements. Provide mentorship and technical guidance to your team members. Less than 25% travel may be required. Required Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree in a technical discipline (e.g., engineering, science, computer science/engineering) 10+ years of relevant system engineering experience Strong written and verbal communication skills Proficiency in software development lifecycles and Agile methodologies Expertise in software system architecture and subsystem-level requirements Experience in MBSE and related tools such as CAMEO and Enterprise Architect U.S. citizenship and an Active DoD Secret Clearance Desired Qualifications: Experience in LVC (Live, Virtual, and Constructive) test or training environments Background in DoD operational test environments Familiarity with cyber testing, network security, MITRE ATT&CK, etc. Familiarity with DoD software and systems development Experience with TENA-based systems Experience modeling systems with Enterprise Architect or CAMEO Experience with containerized applications and tooling (Docker, Kubernetes, etc.) Experience with project management tools and methodologies Familiarity with Modular Open Systems Architecture Standards with Standard Key Interfaces using (FACE, SOSA, SISO, etc.) CSEP or other relevant certification(s) Demonstrated team leadership experience is desired

title: Senior Principal System Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: ASRC Federal Agile Decision Sciences is a premier provider of systems engineering, software engineering, system integration and project management services for real-time, mission-critical defense systems. We are seeking highly motivated System Engineers to support the development and sustainment of the U.S. Missile Defense Agency Ground-Based Midcourse Defense (GMD) anti-ballistic missile system project in Huntsville, AL. This position requires on-site work to be performed in Huntsville, AL. There are no remote work options. As a System Engineer on the IDT Product Engineering, Integration & Test (PEIT) team you will be expected to work in an Agile environment with your peers to plan and execute hardware and software verification activities. You will be expected to utilize Jira and Confluence to track your work and link to activities being performed by other teams. Additionally, you will be expected to decompose Prime Item Development Specification (PIDS) into system or product requirements and to develop Verification documentation for the GWS System. You will coordinate your workday with your team and present your accomplishments at sprint review. Your participation in PEIT team meetings is expected, including customer focused meetings/demonstrations. Our highly skilled engineers are committed to delivering customer-focused results for our clients and put the latest software and applications to use. Want to help advance our nation's critical defense initiatives? title: Supplier Quality Engineer, Electrical
job_description: We are seeking a Supplier Quality Engineer to initiate external supplier quality improvement processes to achieve defect free dock to line parts. In this role, you will have the primary responsibility for performing supplier audits, root cause analysis, and corrective actions for all supplier quality issues. Successful candidates will display knowledge and experience of APQP and PPAP tools as well as Six Sigma and Lean Manufacturing principles. Ideally, this position would sit in our Fort Payne plant; however, we be open to this role sitting in our Chattanooga office with regular travel to the plant as well as to the suppliers.  What you will do as Supplier Quality Engineer: supplier audits ensuring appropriate process and QA controls are in place to allow for dock to line defect free product while ensuring OTD performance.and maintain APQP process that links Heil's internal developmental activities with those of the supply chain.with suppliers to develop and approve PPAPs for new parts.timely resolution and cost recovery efforts related to sub-standard quality purchased components and/or sub-assemblies.efforts to initiate and finalize root cause analysis and corrective actions (i.e., 8Ds, 5Ys, A3s, etc.) with Heil's supply base when issues occur in the plant or field.and analyze product warranty data. Use data to drive focused product quality improvement activities with suppliers.participate with Engineering design teams in new product release and or product improvement activities.knowledge of Six Sigma and Lean techniques to train suppliers to drive process improvement throughout their plants and the whole supply chain.and issues all necessary reports and/or correspondence. Necessary qualifications to be a successful Supplier Quality Engineer:Degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial Engineering or similar background.years’ work experience related to manufacturing quality, purchasing and supply chain or closely related field.Root cause analysis experience with Green/Black belt preferred.Experience troubleshooting Hydraulic Systems, DC Power Systems and Electrical Circuits. Strong analytical and technical abilities with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams as well as lead team projects. Exceptional communication skills with the ability to communicate with internal and external customers at all levels as well as end-users of related products and services. Must be proficient with Microsoft Office, Visio, Project, and Minitab (14B or higher), or QI Macros.Strong organizational and project management skills with the ability to control work processes from beginning to end. Must be able to handle multiple, wide range tasks in a fast-paced environment while still providing carefully thought-out results. Strong negotiation skills with the ability to communicate difficult/sensitive information tactfully.Formal Lean Manufacturing, Six-Sigma experience and ASQC or CQE certification preferred.Travel for this position is between 30%-50%.ABOUT ESG:Environmental Solutions Group encompasses industry-leading brands — Heil Environmental, Marathon, Bayne, The Curotto-Can, 3rd Eye, Soft-Pak, and Parts Central — to create a premier, fully integrated equipment group serving the solid waste and recycling industry. Through extensive voice-of-customer outreach, in-house engineering and manufacturing capabilities, a wide-reaching service network, and proven industry expertise, Environmental Solutions Group is focused on solving customer problems through environmentally responsible products and providing world-class support. Our mission, "Improving Lives," drives us to make a significant difference, both in the marketplace and in the lives of our employees and their communities. For more information, visit www.doveresg.com. title: Senior Principal RF System’s Engineer
job_description: DescriptionLeidos Defense Systems, is seeking a high level Senior Principal RF Systems Engineer to join a diverse team to create unique solutions for complex problems. With offices across the United States engaging in the defense, space, cyber and commercial fields, Leidos provides alert, cost-effective engineering, scientific and IT solutions.The Threat and Cyber Systems Division has a diverse portfolio of projects and programs which specialize in foreign threat radar systems, RF software-in-the-loop (SIL) and hardware-in-the-loop (HWIL) simulators, and open-air radar development. The candidate selected for this position will support projects for the Defense Intelligence Community, military, and large prime contractors.The Sr. Principal RF Systems Engineer duties include performing systems requirements evaluation, functional studies, timeline analysis, trade studies, requirements allocation and interface definition, technical management, integration, system testing, and quality assurance. The candidate will promote development of innovative approaches, solutions, and architecture development. Frequent interaction with the customer through in-process reviews, customer visits and demonstrations are part of the role.QualificationsA bachelor’s degree in electrical engineering or computer engineering (or related technical discipline) from an ABET accredited institute and seventeen (17+) years of relevant work history is needed. If candidate has an MS in a related field fifteen (15+) years of relevant work history is needed.A demonstrated working knowledge of radar fundamentals (familiarity with X-band radar a plus).Familiarity in Microsoft Visual Studio, MATLAB, C++ language and hardware / software in the loop systems.Familiarity with software development, integration, and test and as well as requirements development and verification (modeling and simulation background a plus).Materials, production, and configuration management history is needed.Prior work with Open Air Range integrationThe ideal candidate will have hands-on work in developing, documenting, and executing test processes and procedures for electronic and electromechanical products.Knowledge in implementing risk and engineering change management.Candidate will work with a multi-disciplinary team to develop and implement test procedures and test platforms for a wide variety of hardware. Systems to be tested include analog, mixed-signal, and RF applications. This position will provide the opportunity to work on a variety of interesting projects in a fast-paced environment.Candidate will promote tasks such as review and approval of engineering drawings, bills of materials, and creating work instructions; participation in design reviews; and design and execution of manufacturing test activities.Candidate will be needed to work closely with integration teams to ensure HW/SW design for testability has been considered.Develop use case definitions, capability roadmaps, and overarching guidance.Develop and maintain Architecture Definition, Documentation and PlanningAbility to partner with customer, stakeholders, subcontractors, and integrator team members to bring solution options and drive decisions on the way ahead to meet customer needs.Resolves highly complex problems using significant application of technical knowledge, conceptualizing, reasoning, and interpretation.Comprehend competitor and teammate technology competencies.Review and assess vendor and subcontractor technology solutions.Original Posting Date2024-04-04While subject to change based on business needs, Leidos reasonably anticipates that this job requisition will remain open for at least 3 days with an anticipated close date of no earlier than 3 days after the original posting date as listed above.Pay RangePay Range $144,300.00 - $260,850.00The Leidos pay range for this job level is a general guideline only and not a guarantee of compensation or salary. title: Senior Software Safety Engineer (ONSITE) with Security Clearance
job_description: 2024-04-11CountryDate Posted:United States of AmericaLocation:MA803: Marlborough, MA Building 3 1001 Boston Post Road Building 3, Marlborough, MA, 01752 USAPosition Role Type:Onsite About Us: At Raytheon, the foundation of everything we do is rooted in our values and a higher calling - to help our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. We bring the strength of more than 100 years of experience and renowned engineering expertise to meet the needs of today's mission and stay ahead of tomorrow's threat. Our team solves tough, meaningful problems that create a safer, more secure world. Life Cycle Engineering (LCE) is responsible for ensuring our products are Safe, Reliable, Maintainable and delivered on time. Life Cycle Engineering consists of multiple disciplines that support engineering, our program offices and our customers. Our Life Cycle Engineering disciplines participate in the total life cycle of our products from conception to deactivation. Our focus area is product support, including the following disciplines: Reliability System Safety and Supportability. Job Summary: Are you looking for the chance to join a dynamic team working on some of RTX's most cutting-edge products such as LTAMDS, GhostEye, SPY6, and Patriot? If so, this job may be a perfect match! As a Sr. Software Safety Engineer, your responsibilities will include: * Analysis of engineering software, and/or firmware, IAW MIL-STD-882E, JSSSEH, AOP-52, etc. Work with software development teams to review and analyze embedded software code Collaborating with Program Management and government approval authorities from program startup through deployment to gain concurrence with software builds This position is posted as ONSITE and can be based in either Marlborough, MA or Huntsville, AL. Responsibilities to Anticipate: * Performing Software and/or Firmware analyses Executing the Software System Safety Program Mentoring junior engineers Interfacing with stakeholders (e.g. customers, program offices, subcontractors, vendors) Preparing Safety Assessment Reports and Safety Program Briefs for Customer Approval Briefing software safety of the program at technical reviews and as part of the safety approval process Interpreting system requirements, customer specifications and military standards Collaborating across multiple disciplines to gain a full understanding of product architecture and design Basic Qualifications: * Typically Requires: Bachelor's degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Math (STEM) and a minimum 5 years of relevant engineering or statistics or data analysis experience. An advanced degree may account for additional years of experience as required for this position. * Experience with: System Safety Engineering, System Engineering, Software or Firmware Engineering, or equivalent Safety Engineering The ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. government issued security clearance is required. U.S. citizenship is required, as only U.S. citizens are eligible for a security clearance. Preferred Qualifications: * Experience with DoD System Safety Programs Strong written, verbal and presentation skills Strong interpersonal and project management skills, with the ability to manage a safety program and provide direction to supporting safety personnel Master's Degree in Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) What We Offer Whether you are just starting out on your career journey or are an experienced professional, we offer a total rewards package that goes above and beyond with compensation; healthcare, wellness, retirement and work/life benefits; career development and recognition programs. Some of the outstanding benefits on offer include parental (including paternal) leave, flexible work schedules, achievement awards, educational assistance and child/adult backup care. This includes all production and maintenance employees, as they are essential to the development of our products. title: Principal Software Safety Engineer (ONSITE) with Security Clearance
job_description: 2024-04-11CountryDate Posted:United States of AmericaLocation:MA803: Marlborough, MA Building 3 1001 Boston Post Road Building 3, Marlborough, MA, 01752 USAPosition Role Type:Onsite About Us: At Raytheon, the foundation of everything we do is rooted in our values and a higher calling - to help our nation and allies defend freedoms and deter aggression. Our team solves tough, meaningful problems that create a safer, more secure world. Life Cycle Engineering (LCE) is responsible for ensuring our products are Safe, Reliable, Maintainable and delivered on time. Life Cycle Engineering consists of multiple disciplines that support engineering, our program offices and our customers. Our Life Cycle Engineering disciplines participate in the total life cycle of our products from conception to deactivation. Our focus area is product support, including the following disciplines: Reliability System Safety and Supportability. If so, this job may be a perfect match! title: Maintenance Engineer
job_description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Jobot, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!Elevate your engineering career by ensuring cutting-edge equipment reliability and performance!This Jobot Job is hosted by: Ryan WeingardtAre you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.Salary: $87,000 - $112,000 per yearA bit about us:We are an innovative organization committed to excellence and continuous improvement. At the heart of our operations is a relentless pursuit of reliability and sustainability, ensuring that every project and process is aligned with our core values of integrity, quality, and innovation. We strive to lead our industry by adopting the most advanced technologies and practices, making our environment a beacon for professionals who are eager to make a significant impact.Why join us?Impactful Work: Play a pivotal role in enhancing operational efficiencies across multiple plant teams.Continuous Learning: Stay at the forefront of your field with opportunities to explore and implement cutting-edge maintenance methodologies.Collaborative Environment: Engage with cross-functional teams to foster a culture of shared knowledge and collective problem-solving.Career Development: Benefit from a structured path for professional growth, emphasizing innovation in reliability engineering.Advanced Tools and Technologies: Utilize leading-edge tools such as CMMS, and be a part of deploying groundbreaking maintenance strategies.Culture of Excellence: Join a team where planned and predictive maintenance strategies are not just concepts, but a way of life.Job DetailsThe Reliability Engineer champions the implementation of reliability best practices. This role will also evaluate new best-known methods and technologies to continuously improve equipment reliability.Key aspects of this position include:Working with various plant teams and areas to identify, evaluate, and implement reliability improvement opportunities through changes to operating and maintenance procedures, and equipment upgrades.Analyzing equipment history to identify reliability improvement opportunities.Deploying root cause analysis methods and tools on problems or failures that have resulted in consequential impacts related to machine downtime and / or maintenance expense.Participating in new equipment selection and deployment processes to ensure reliability and maintainability principles are included in the design and implementation activities.Supporting the Autonomous Maintenance process by contributing to the design and selection of operator inspections and tasks to sustain equipment condition and performance.Promoting the following reliability strategies: Planned corrective maintenance is more effective than reactive maintenance. Time based preventive maintenance is more effective than plan corrective maintenance. Condition based (predictive) maintenance is more effective than time based preventive maintenance. Prevention of maintenance is the best comprehensive maintenance strategy.Participating in audits to measure and validate progression and performance in the reliability journey.Utilizing reliability centered maintenance (RCM) principles to optimize the equipment maintenance strategy.Serving as a subject matter expert of the computerized maintenance management system (CMMS) and assist in end user training efforts to ensure master and transactional data integrity and accuracy.Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Maintenance Engineer

title: HVAC Technician
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  Welcome to JLLJob SummaryOperates, inspects, and maintains all HVAC, refrigeration, and mechanical equipment and systems in assigned facilities to obtain most efficient operating results and life expectancy. Assures that equipment is being maintained in an energy efficient, safe manner and down time is reduced to a minimum by anticipation of necessary repairs and maintenance Individuals are expected to demonstrate technical expertise in HVAC and refrigeration and be multi skilled in electrical, HVAC, Piping/Plumbing and others in order to successfully complete daily/weekly work assignments.Pay: $22.54-$32.69 Hourly PBOESchedule: M-F 8 hour shift between 05:30AM-06:00 AM; Weekends; Holidays as neededArea of ResponsibilityEssential FunctionsPerformance of ongoing preventive and repair response work orders on facility mechanical systems, equipment, and other associated components.Maintain, operate, and repair all HVAC/R systems and associated equipment at assigned locations or as directed. Typical systems and equipment could include HVAC Systems: (Air Handling Unit System (AHU), Fan Coil Units (FCU's), Variable Air Volume & Constant Air Volume terminal (VAV & CAV), component fans, dampers, coils, fan powered variable air volume & constant volume and package units, UVC Lighting systems in AHUs, Chilled Water Systems, Water Systems, Water Treatment Systems, Thru Wall Heating and Cooling Units, Pumping Systems (mechanical), Air Distribution Systems, Exhaust Systems, Backflow Prevention Systems, Direct Digital Control (DDC), Central Control Panel, Energy Management or Building Management (EMS & BMS) Systems, Electric Duct Heaters, Fire Pump, Jockey Pump, and Associated Systems, and Heat Tracing Systems.Study and become familiar with the various items of equipment, and the methods required to use them properly, that are required in everyday activities.Perform assigned facility inspections and due diligence efforts, reporting on as found conditions impacting satisfactory client occupancy and operations.Monitor the operation and make adjustments on refrigeration, heat exchanger, HVAC, electrical, emergency backup systems and hot water systems; monitors operation, adjusts, and maintains refrigeration, chilled water, and air conditioning equipment; boilers, and ventilating and hot water heaters; pumps, valves, piping and filters; other mechanical and electrical equipment; record readings and make adjustments where necessary to assure proper operation of equipment. Requires the ability to analyze the operation of various systems, determine the cause of any problems/malfunctions and take corrective action as required. Performs preventive maintenance on all base building and critical system equipment which includes but not limited to: assembling all tools, supplies and instruments necessary to complete the job, performing work with a minimum amount disruption, conducting immediate clean up of work area, completing the preventive task sheet, returning tools to workshop, and unused supplies to store room, reporting any equipment problems, impending supply or material shortages to the Assistant Chief Engineer. Install and repairs plumbing/piping/tubing; wire single and three phase motors (under the direction of Assistant Chief Engineer); operating parts, etc.; install and rebuild pumps and motors; install and rebuild air compressors; heat exchangers; replace bearings in all types of motors; replace seals on pumps; install and repair piping, valves, filters, hot water systems and associated controls; assist other mechanics and operators with major repairs and maintenance of building and equipment. Installs, repairs, and maintains electrical controls, switching and motor controls. Ensures that all appropriate R&M data (e.g., material costs, contract labor costs, Jones Lang LaSalle effort) is captured on a work order Review and analyzing system data (e.g., reliability, 1 calls) and developing initial recommendation with Assistant Chief Engineer on any maintenance changes, upgrades, replacements, etc. Maintain up to date & complete system documentation in a central resource location, for all repairs or changes to the system Maintains tools and orders supplies as required for installation and repairs Complies with departmental policy for the safe storage, usage and disposal of hazardous materials Supports other task/work as assigned Education And ExperienceDesired experience and technical skillsRequiredCandidate must possess and maintain a valid state driver's licenseType III Universal EPA 608 CertificationMinimum of four (4) years of technical experience in all aspects of building engineering with a strong background in technical aspects of packaged HVAC, plumbing electrical equipment repair and maintenance.Must be able to lift up to 80 lbs. and climb up to 30 ft. ladders.Ability to perform on call duties and overtime as required.Knowledge of overall MEP/HVAC system design and application.Experience managing work orders, utilizing CMMS technologyExperience working in a service-related role, specific to commercial facilities.Candidate must possess and maintain a valid state driver's licenseKnowledge of OSHA standards and local codes Team player, hard worker, good interpersonal skills, ability to communicate well in both oral and written reports Good verbal and written communications skills are required Familiar with computer equipment and programs Must have the ability to receive a clearance sponsored by the companyMust support the on-call rotation as required for business.Location:On-site -Huntsville, AlabamaIf this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply, even if you don't meet all the requirements. We're interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!Personalized Benefits That Support Personal Well-being And GrowthJLL recognizes the impact that the workplace can have on your wellness, so we offer a supportive culture and comprehensive benefits package that prioritizes mental, physical and emotional health. title: JCOFA Intelligence Analyst, Senior- TS/SCI
job_description: CIS00027RYour ImpactSupports the National Ground Intelligence Center (NGIC) in the development of Foundational Future Order of Battle data for Joint Country Forces Analysis (JCOFA), Military Modernization (MILMOD) Program, and Analytic Enabling (AE) activities in support of the Department of Defense (DoD) and Intelligence Community (IC).ResponsibilitiesConduct intelligence research (i.e., gather data from current OB databases and common sources of intelligence), perform analysis resulting in future OB projections, and provide narrative inputs explaining the logic behind the analysisConvert Government analysis to the specifics of units and equipment, e.g., add support equipment, personnel, munitions, and unit structure to weapons systems projected by Government analystsEnter Government and Contractor derived data from JCOFA production into the JACOB database application. Entries shall be in accordance with the guidelines published in the “JCOFA Data production rules for Foreign Units and Equipment”Conduct review meetings with Government Program Manager, to ensure compliance of Production GuidanceDetermine, correct, and report to the Government unintended conflicts or inconsistencies within the databaseRun customized and standard database reports (Top-Down Hierarchy, Tables of Organization and Equipment (TO&E) Roll- Up, Unit List), on request to facilitate coordination with other Intelligence Centers and combatant commandsWrite narrative assessments and build weapon systems configuration tables in accordance with the JCOFA Requirements Review the database for discrepancies, compare the database to supporting narratives, and coordinate with Government analysts to resolve any inconsistencies.#divergentHere’s What You’ll NeedBe proficient in the use of the JACOB database or equivalent OB database application with a minimum of one year experience using the application and the demonstrated ability to build a futures OB database in the OB application by creating units, and adding weapons systems, equipment, and personnel to the unit.Have a minimum of one year experience using all-source data to analyze foreign forces, equipment, and C3 systems, converting the analysis into database format, and providing narrative input explaining the logic behind the analysis.Have experience running OB database application reports and (ad hoc) reportsClearance RequiredTS/SCIPreferredDesired experience is a minimum 12 years of experience related to the specific labor category with at least a portion of the experience within the last 2 years.Desired Master’s degree in an area related to the labor category from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education; or have Bachelor’s degree related to the labor category from a college or university accredited by an agency recognized by the U.S. Department of Education and an additional 5 years of related senior experience, for a total of 17 years, as a substitute to the Master’s degree.

title: 35F Intelligence Analyst
job_description: On the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the threat. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. You’ll gain Military Intelligence training, education, and a security clearance that could open doors to rewarding career opportunities with other intelligence agencies.Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparing all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-referencing intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and preparing and maintaining enemy situational graphics.Job DutiesPreparing all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssessing the significance and reliability of incoming intelligence collectionEstablishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesSome Of The Skills You’ll LearnCritical thinkingThe ability to use sophisticated mapping tools, intelligence networks, and systems to identify the evolving threat on the battlefieldGather information utilizing premier digital and analytical tools to create products for the CommanderHelpful SkillsAnalytical thinking; gathering information, and understanding of relevancyInterest in reading maps and chartsMore than any other branch of service, the Army National Guard offers a wide range of intelligence-related positions. Through your training, you will develop skills and experience to create opportunities for a civilian career with federal agencies like the National Security Agency.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance and certifications. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. You’ll learn in the classroom and gain experience in the field. Completion of your initial entry training in the Army National Guard could also lead to additional college credit.
Industries: Government Relations Services, International Affairs, and Security and Investigations

title: OSP Engineering Manager
job_description: Company OverviewCircet USA is an industry leading provider of Network Services solutions in North America. Our experienced workforce of over 2,000 professionals is skilled at planning, consulting, engineering, construction, program management and combined engineering, procurement, and construction (EPC) solutions to meet our customer’s rapidly changing infrastructure needs. We offer the most comprehensive solutions in the industry across ISP, OSP, Wireline, and Wireless.Our customers include telecom service providers, MSO’s, cloud service providers, and utilities. With nearly 50 years of experience, we have the ability to customize solutions to meet our customer’s unique needs.Job Summary And ResponsibilitiesThe OSP Engineering Manager is responsible for the Design Deliveries of a specified FTTH program and for ensuring end-to-end efficiency toward a turnkey program. The OSP Engineering Manager leads the Local Program Design Team and will oversee OSP design efforts, coordinate the primary fielding work, produce the High-Level-Design, and produce the Low-Level-Design. They will also work with the Design Team on the requested CAD Drawing for permitting and Right Of Way application, provide pole calculation and pole attachment requirements to the facility owners, evaluate related Bill Of Materials and produces the project closeouts.The OSP Engineering Manager will oversee the quality design deliveries, check underground and aerial drawings, check splice plans, and provide field support to construction team members and installation subcontractors for the specified market.For Engineering and Design project requirements, this individual will communicate and work daily with the local design team, the national KGP Engineering Department and KGP Services Offshore Design Department and assist with all aspects of project coordination and scheduling.For project and construction requirements, this individual will communicate and support daily with project team members from various departments and assist with all aspects of project coordination and IT tools development.Ability to manage tight deadlines, manage multiple workflows through various stages of the project life cycle, maintain accurate records, and provide progress reports are important elements to be successful in this position. It is also important this individual can calculate the global and individual productivity of their team.In addition, this role is responsible to support business improvement by meeting personal and departmental goals and objectives timely and effectively.ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: other duties may be assigned: Fielding Works Data inputs  Fielding Works deliveries for Living Units, poles, underground specifications, existing facilities.  High Level Design for OSA and PSA  Low Level Design per PSA  Pole attachment and calculation  Underground CAD drawings on Right of Way  Design fiber route and create necessary splicing prints and work orders for internal and external teams  Engineer/design outside plant construction  Provide data and assignment to the construction team  Assist in the planning, analysis, design and engineering of outside plant network structures and facilities  Skillfully communicate to establish and maintain positive and productive working relationships and drive projects to completion  Actively engage with internal partners to ensure timelines and cost/expense thresholds are met  Perform administrative work relating to projects and assignments  Identify pole ownership, right of way and permit requirements  Identify and communicate issues and assist with resolutions  Follow best-practice project planning and status reporting standards per established processes  Minimize errors and inefficiencies  Prepare project and program statistics and reports  Calculate the productivity of the Engineering and Design Team and optimize its profitability.  Review and resolution of correspondence and sensitive documents  Coordinate communications plans including email, newsletters, and presentations.  Work with state, county and local jurisdictional agencies, utilities, canal districts, railroads, and governmental authorities to obtain approval of proposed placement of OSP facilities.  Have the ability to recognize/identify Engineering design drawings, and the ability to take field notes, if necessary. Qualifications 3-5 years of in depth knowledge and experience with OSP Engineering, including underground and aerial design and placement, development of fiber splice plans, OTDR and PM/LS testing, OSP materials sourcing, NESC rules and regulations applicable to communications networks is required.  Experience managing a team is strongly preferred  Proficient with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and SharePoint  Proficient with QGIS, ARCGIS, IQGEO, SIG, AUTOCAD  Strong organizational and time management skills  Strong written and oral communication skills  Ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks  Must be resourceful, flexible and maintain the ability to react and respond quickly with a focus on accuracy and details.  Displays initiative and strong sense of personal motivation as well as responsibility.  Knowledge of the principles, methods, processes, and applicable regulations.  Knowledge of working with government agencies, jurisdictions, and right of ways  Experience with permit applications/documents.  Knowledge of relevant technology and equipment. Must have good judgment, decision-making ability, and attention to detail. Circet USA is an Equal Opportunity Employer – M/F/Veteran/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity

title: Material Handling Regional Specialist
job_description: Material Handling Regional Specialist Job Description – Southern RegionThe material handling (MH) regional product specialist will oversee the overall sales material handling sales target and own the relationships with key material handling suppliers within their respective regions. The goal is to grow top line sales while also growing our profit margins. The MH specialist should actively pursue increasing sales within each region by working with all sales engineers within the region, so they feel comfortable discussing and reviewing material handling applications as they come up within their accounts. The Material Handling Specialist should be the Strategic Resource and First contact for the Sales Engineers in their region to ensure all information regarding customer requests is accurate and address the needs of the customer prior to sending it to our MH partners. MH will work daily with sales engineers in their region to drive sales of MH Products. The Material handling Regional Specialist will report directly to the RSM for that region.Success for the Material Handling Specialist is gauges on the Success of these three items: Sales, Growth, Margin.The Material Handling Regional Specialist complete a variety of leadership responsibilities, including:Create a yearly business plan to grow their region’s material handling sales in all key areas of focus. These include but are not limited to: conveyors, cranes, jibs, hoists, carts, lift assists, intelligent lift assists, and of course all our design and build products. The D&B products are Hovair, Lathrup, CTEK, and GD Hoist.Participate in the regional huddle calls with the sales engineers to promote material handling products and various promotions.From time to time, you may be asked to participate in the Ops and Props sales call to discuss success stories from your region.Using market data, statistics, and trends to establish annual sales goals for your specific region in material handling products.Review sales numbers weekly to ensure your material handling sales are growing.Build relationships with our top suppliers for material handling within your region.Put together business plans required by key suppliers on how you are going to grow their product sales within your region.Participate in sales meetings with other material handling regional specialists that would be put on by the VP of Material Handling.Help with marketing plans, suggested trade shows and other road shows to help promote Rhino Tool House within your region.Recognizing and rewarding top sales producers for material handling within your region.Work with the National Accounts manager to help select key accounts and hold RSM’s accountable for creating a plan to gain material handling market share within these selected accounts.Discuss key material handling accounts with other reginal material handling specialists that you may have in your territory and use our existing relationships in these other accounts to gain access to the selected account within your region.Cross-functional collaboration: Each regional material handling specialist will collaborate with various departments within the organization, such as finance, operations, and supply chain, to ensure smooth coordination and alignment of activities related to sales.Collaborate with regional managers to get “middle of the road” and “low” producing salespeople to high performing status in your product focus category.Preparing timely sales forecasts and reports on material handling products.Tracking and analyzing sales data to find strengths, opportunities, weaknesses, and trends.Networking with existing customers and potential customers to promote the Rhino Tool House brand and ethics.Creating presentations for business updates with suppliers, corporate executives, and the regions they are responsible for.Ensuring CRM data is up to date for your region and each sales engineer for the material handling products you represent.Track material handling leads for your region and ensure that these are followed up on vigorously with a sense of urgency.Review KPIs for the material handling products within your region.Sales vs previous yearMargin vs previous yearSales growth by each sales engineerNew material handling customersInspection and Installation sales vs previous yearEtcParticipate in monthly one-on-one call with your manager to discuss sales personnel, large projects, sales funnel, lost orders, opportunities, and challenges.Prepare an annual plan to reach the desired sales goal.Help support integration of newly acquired companies into the Rhino Tool House sales team.Five specific areas of expertise for the regional material handling product specialist are:Core Values, Mission, and Vision StatementLiving the Rhino Tool House core values and our mission and vision statements is key to creating a positive environment for our employees, customers, and stakeholders. Each specialist should be well versed in these areas.Drive SalesThe regional material handling product specialist should set sales targets for their region using past sales statistics and market information. They oversee material handling sales within their teams and give guidance on sales strategies and processes. They should also motivate individuals to reach goals, using reports that document sales projections, actual revenue, and other metrics. Participating in weekly forecasting calls and updating senior management is key to ensuring the company is aware of projections and trends.Awareness of market trendsRegional material handling product specialists should continuously track and record sales trends and other related data to improve supply and demand strategies and maximize profits. Supply and demand often drive both sales strategies and revenue. This also relates to reporting on key wins and losses. Detailing specifics about both wins and losses is key to Rhino Tool House continuing to improve for our customers.Advertising and marketingRegional material handling product specialists will work closely with our marketing team to improve sales, company awareness and trade shows. They may provide historical sales data and forecast estimates so they can create effective advertising and marketing strategies. They might also review the success of a competitor's advertising and marketing campaign so that they can review and adjust their own.Customer serviceA regional material handling product specialist should have good customer service skills to help influence clients, potential customers, and the sales teams. Providing excellent customer service will lead to higher profits, and they should be able to train and share this information with their teams on best practices.Additionally Required AttributesCommunication: Strong written and oral communication skills are helpful for connecting with clients and sales team members across the country or region, especially regarding timely information.Creativity: They should collaborate with the regional manager to help create innovative sales ideas to increase revenue and profits. Focusing on new ways to reach customers, demo products, highlight successes, etc.Sales knowledge: Effective material handling product specialists should have an extensive understanding of sales funnels, processes, and functions. Having mastery of the MODERN sales process is key to driving a unified sales approach across our regions and sales team.Team management: Your ability to help lead, motivate, and supervise a team will help the region grow sales by consistently challenging the sales engineers to grow their existing and future customer base in material handling sales. Also, helping the regionals establish a business case to add additional salespeople is key to organic growth.Persuasiveness: Material handling product specialists must have the ability to be persuasive which will help us increase sales with key customers and get more leads and favorable treatment from our suppliers.Other ItemsCandidates for this position should be willing to travel up to 40% of the time within their region of responsibility.Reports directly to the regional manager of the region you are working in.

title: Civil Stuctural Designer

Recognizing and communicating scope and design changes promptly. Experience with Advanced Steel.

title: 35F Intelligence Analyst
job_description: On the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the threat. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. You’ll gain Military Intelligence training, education, and a security clearance that could open doors to rewarding career opportunities with other intelligence agencies.Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparing all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-referencing intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and preparing and maintaining enemy situational graphics.Job DutiesPreparing all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssessing the significance and reliability of incoming intelligence collectionEstablishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesSome Of The Skills You’ll LearnCritical thinkingThe ability to use sophisticated mapping tools, intelligence networks, and systems to identify the evolving threat on the battlefieldGather information utilizing premier digital and analytical tools to create products for the CommanderHelpful SkillsAnalytical thinking; gathering information, and understanding of relevancyInterest in reading maps and chartsMore than any other branch of service, the Army National Guard offers a wide range of intelligence-related positions. Through your training, you will develop skills and experience to create opportunities for a civilian career with federal agencies like the National Security Agency.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance and certifications. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. You’ll learn in the classroom and gain experience in the field. Completion of your initial entry training in the Army National Guard could also lead to additional college credit.
Industries: Government Relations Services, International Affairs, and Security and Investigations

title: Cloud & Cyber - Application Modernization with Security Clearance
job_description: Overview Axient has contingent career opportunities to support the AvMC Application Modernization and migration to Cloud efforts. These positions are contingent upon contract award and will be located in Huntsville, AL. Responsibilities The AvMC is evaluating cloud based information technology infrastructure to host mission systems, applications, services, and data. This environment will serve the Army DEVCOM stakeholder community. The end state is to enable Army DEVCOMs to make fully informed, data driven decisions, based on authoritative and/or production data sources. This cloud-based environment accomplishes this end state by providing a build-for-purpose application hosting environment for the eco-system of applications aligned to the AvMC's mission and business processes. Axient would provide support services to further improve upon AvMC's cloud environment. This includes data and software engineering support for the DEVCOM DevSecOps Teams, application migration support, and additional expert service support. Axient will provide the expertise necessary to strategize, design, and continually improve AvMC's use of commercial cloud environments. These services will:Provide an enterprise level, cloud based environment to support the computing, data storage, data access, application development, and analytic process of Army Futures Command.Enable the migration of subordinate elements to a cloud environment by providing the necessary shared commons services and cyber security controls inheritance.Support the migration of enterprise and mission applications currently hosted on Non-classified Internet Protocol Router Network (NIPRNet), Secure Internet Protocol Router Network (SIPRNet), Defense Research and Engineering Network (DREN), and Secure Defense Research and Engineering Network (SDREN).Establish a centralized data warehouse containing curated, rationalized data.Establish an enterprise DevSecOps capability to support development and deployment of future applications drawing data from, and populating data to, the central warehouse.Establish an enterprise Data Science capability to support innovative analysis. As part of this effort, Axient is looking for experienced personnel to support the Technical Solution Delivery aspect in the area of Cloud & Cybersecurity (Platform Team) to fill the following roles:Cloud Solutions ArchitectCloud Solutions EngineerCloud Solutions DeveloperCloud Systems AdministratorCloud Cybersecurity EngineerCloud Cybersecurity ArchitectApplication Security Engineer Qualifications Minimum Requirements: Specific minimum requirements will vary depending on role and level. All positions require US Citizenship, and an active DoD Secret Clearance. Some positions will require certain levels of certifications. Additional skill and Experience to support this team include, but are not limited to:Deep understanding of the design, deployment and management of cloud resources in numerous environments (AWS, Azure, etc.)Familiarity with Kubernetes implementation in Cloud environmentsAbility to prioritize usage to most efficiently allocate resources to maximize developer experience and stay within budgetKnowledge of networking, security groups and policy management in relation to cloud resourcesApplicable Azure and AWS certifications (SysOps Administrator, Solutions Architect Associate) and/or Azure certifications (Administrator, Architect Technologies/Design)Possesses a strong "security first" mindset. Desired Skills:Familiarity with Agile, Scrum, or Kanban frameworksDevOps or DevSecOps certification or trainingOther applicable AWS or Azure certifications, Security certifications #CJ #CJ

title: Senior Quality Engineer
job_description: Job Description What is it like working for Integrated Survivability Solutions product line (ISS) within the Countermeasure and Electromagnetic Attack Solutions (CEMA) business area?Impactful – take a look at some of the products we support:https://www.baesystems.com/en-us/productfamily/countermeasure-and-electromagnetic-attack-solutionsThis position will be located at one of our newest, state-of-the-art BAE Systems facilities in Huntsville, AL.You will support the Integrated Survivability Solutions product line (ISS) within the Countermeasure and Electromagnetic Attack Solutions (CEMA) business areaThe Senior Quality Engineer (QE) is responsible for ensuring seamless transition and ongoing support of projects transitioning from New Hampshire and Texas facilities as well as newly assigned contracts to assure that the products or services meet the established standards of quality including reliability, usability and performance. This will include the entire program life cycle (Proposal, Design, Production, Services, and Sustainment). The QE will utilize their expertise in Quality to ensure compliance, drive process improvements, lead root cause corrective actions and guide business decisions with data.This individual needs to have solid communications skills as well as having the ability to engage across all levels of the organization in building effective relationships.As a Part Of An Interdisciplinary Program Team, The Quality Engineer Will Be Involved In (but Not Limited To) The Following Reviewing Customer requirements to ensure proper flow down Quality Management System audits of manufacturing areas Interact with Procurement, Supply Chain, Operations, Program Office and other Engineering disciplines as required Frequent interaction with the Customer thru Customer Source Inspection and preparation and presentation of Customer documentation Serving as the overall voice of the customer to ensure that all requirements are accurately satisfied Data Extraction /Analysis /Compilation Root Cause and Corrective Action AnalysisOur flexible work environment (ex. 9/80 Schedule -working 80 hours over nine days with every other Friday off) provides you a chance to change the world without giving up your personal life. We put our customers first – exemplified by our mission: “We Protect Those Who Protect Us®.” Sound like a team you want to be a part of? Come build your career with BAE Systems.Required Education, Experience, & SkillsBachelor's Degree and 4 years work experience or 8 years of experience in lieu of degreeHardware Quality experience in commercial, automotive, or aerospace & defense Strong Collaborative skills both within and external to the Quality FunctionAble to read and comprehend drawings, specifications and contract requirements.Ability to drive successful completion of Root Cause, Corrective and Preventive ActionsSelf-motivated and able to manage daily priorities with minimal oversight and directionPreferred Education, Experience, & Skills Experience with AS9100, PPV/AS9102 FAI, and AS9145/PPAPGreen Belt/Black Belt CertifiedAbility to devise sampling procedures and directions for recording and reporting quality dataPerform and Document internal audits and other quality assurance activitiesAbility to effectively teach/communicate quality principles and program requirements to non-quality personnelAbility to manipulate and analyze data (ex. excel pivot table, trend charts)Secret Clearance or ability to attainExperience using TipQA or other Quality DatabasesPlan, conduct and monitor testing and inspection of materials and products to ensure finished product qualityFamiliarity with Metrology standardsExperience with CMMI Software Quality Assurance RequirementsPay InformationFull-Time Salary Range: $83900 - $142600Please note: This range is based on our market pay structures. However, individual salaries are determined by a variety of factors including, but not limited to: business considerations, local market conditions, and internal equity, as well as candidate qualifications, such as skills, education, and experience.Employee Benefits: At BAE Systems, we support our employees in all aspects of their life, including their health and financial well-being. Regular employees scheduled to work 20+ hours per week are offered: health, dental, and vision insurance; health savings accounts; a 401(k) savings plan; disability coverage; and life and accident insurance. We also have an employee assistance program, a legal plan, and other perks including discounts on things like home, auto, and pet insurance. Our leave programs include paid time off, paid holidays, as well as other types of leave, including paid parental, military, bereavement, and any applicable federal and state sick leave. Employees may participate in the company recognition program to receive monetary or non-monetary recognition awards. Other incentives may be available based on position level and/or job specifics.About BAE Systems Electronic Systems BAE Systems, Inc. is the U.S. subsidiary of BAE Systems plc, an international defense, aerospace and security company which delivers a full range of products and services for air, land and naval forces, as well as advanced electronics, security, information technology solutions and customer support services. Improving the future and protecting lives is an ambitious mission, but it’s what we do at BAE Systems. Working here means using your passion and ingenuity where it counts – defending national security with breakthrough technology, superior products, and intelligence solutions. As you develop the latest technology and defend national security, you will continually hone your skills on a team—making a big impact on a global scale. At BAE Systems, you’ll find a rewarding career that truly makes a difference. Electronic Systems (ES) is the global innovator behind BAE Systems’ game-changing defense and commercial electronics. Exploiting every electron, we push the limits of what is possible, giving our customers the edge and our employees opportunities to change the world. Our products and capabilities can be found everywhere – from the depths of the ocean to the far reaches of space. At our core are more than 14,000 highly talented Electronic Systems employees with the brightest minds in the industry, we make an impact – for our customers and the communities we serve.Our Commitment To Diversity, Equity, And InclusionAt BAE Systems, we work hard every day to nurture an inclusive culture where employees are valued and feel like they belong. We are conscious of the need for all employees to see themselves reflected at every level of the company and know that in order to unlock the full potential of our workforce, everyone must feel confident being their best, most sincere self and be equipped to thrive. We provide impactful professional development experiences to our employees and invest in social impact partnerships to uplift communities and drive purposeful change. Here you will find significant opportunities to do meaningful work in an environment intentionally designed to be one where you will learn, grow and belong.

title: Senior Quality Engineer
job_description: As a Senior Quality Engineer, you will ensure that products manufactured at the PPG Huntsville Aerospace Transparency facility meet customer’s requirements for conformity, support products and processes, and foster customer satisfaction. You will identify quality, product, process, and production issues for improvement and corrective/preventative actions to ensure zero impact to the customer must be your passion.Key ResponsibilitiesManage and perform First Article Inspections on PPG products observing AS9102.Manage customer specific requirements by offering technical support to internal and external Design Engineering authority throughout design, development, qualification, and production of products.Manage several transparency projects.Lead, implement, and maintain APQP & PPAP projects.Investigating quality escapes to our customers with the goal of leading problem-solving teams to develop corrective actions that prevent recurrence.Work with Engineering, Production, Lean, and Supply Chain to resolve product issues.Use Quality Tools to solve issues methodically and present resolution to leadership.Maintain main quality metrics to establish baselines and track improvement.Develop yearly improvement plans, which include Six Sigma methodologies, improving process capabilities.Participating in analyzing rejected or returned product for conformance to specifications and associated corrective actions.Occasional (20% or less) travel to support multiple customers in the US and internationally.QualificationsBachelor’s degree in an engineering, quality assurance, or related technical field required5 years of quality engineering related experience within a manufacturing environment required,Experience within an aerospace/OEM company preferred.Previous Configuration Management Experience and experience working with Product Data Management (PDM) systems preferred.Communicate at a high level, and representing PPG quality management.Experience needed includes: Certified Quality Engineer (CQE); Quality Engineering in Aerospace/Automotive Manufacturing; APQP, PPAP, FMEA, Controls Plans; Lean Manufacturing / Six Sigma; Design Engineering; Root Cause Corrective Action; Corrective Action Board; Material Review Board; Familiarity working within an AS9100 compliant QMS; Deep understanding of AS9102.Must be a US CitizenPPG pay ranges and benefits can vary by location which allows us to compensate employees competitively in different geographic markets. PPG considers several factors in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, qualifications and education, licensure and certifications, and other organizational needs. Other incentives may apply.Our employee benefits programs are designed to support the health and well-being of our employees. Any insurance coverages and benefits will be in accordance with the terms and conditions of the applicable plans and associated governing plan documents.About UsHere at PPG we make it happen, and we seek candidates of the highest integrity and professionalism who share our values, with the commitment and drive to strive today to do better than yesterday – everyday.PPG: WE PROTECT AND BEAUTIFY THE WORLD™Through leadership in innovation, sustainability and color, PPG helps customers in industrial, transportation, consumer products, and construction markets and aftermarkets to enhance more surfaces in more ways than does any other company.. To learn more, visit www.ppg.com and follow @ PPG on Twitter.The PPG WayEvery Single Day At PPGWe partner with customers to create mutual value.We are “One PPG” to the world.We trust our people every day, in every way.We make it happen.We run it like we own it.We do better today than yesterday – everyday.PPG provides equal opportunity to all candidates and employees. We offer an opportunity to grow and develop your career in an environment that provides a fulfilling workplace for employees, creates an environment for continuous learning, and embraces the ideas and diversity of others. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, pregnancy, race, color, creed, religion, national origin, age, disability status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression. If you need assistance to complete your application due to a disability, please email recruiting@ppg.com.PPG values your feedback on our recruiting process. We encourage you to visit Glassdoor.com and provide feedback on the process, so that we can do better today than yesterday.Benefits will be discussed with you by your recruiter during the hiring process.

title: 35F Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionOn the battlefield, success depends on accurate and timely intel. As an Army National Guard Intelligence Analyst, you will play a key role in the interpretation and exploitation of information gathered from or about the threat. Intelligence Analysts provide Guard personnel with information about enemy forces and potential battle areas, and use information derived from all intelligence disciplines to determine changes in enemy capabilities, vulnerabilities, and probable courses of action. You'll gain Military Intelligence training, education, and a security clearance that could open doors to rewarding career opportunities with other intelligence agencies.Specific duties of the Intelligence Analyst may include: preparing all-source intelligence products; providing Intelligence, Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (ISR) Synchronization support; processing incoming reports and messages; determining the significance and reliability of incoming information; establishing and maintaining systematic, cross-referencing intelligence records and files; integrating incoming information with current intelligence holdings; and preparing and maintaining enemy situational graphics.Job DutiesPreparing all-source intelligence products to support the combat commanderAssessing the significance and reliability of incoming intelligence collectionEstablishing and maintaining systematic, cross-reference intelligence records and filesSome Of The Skills You'll LearnCritical thinkingThe ability to use sophisticated mapping tools, intelligence networks, and systems to identify the evolving threat on the battlefieldGather information utilizing premier digital and analytical tools to create products for the CommanderHelpful SkillsAnalytical thinking; gathering information, and understanding of relevancyInterest in reading maps and chartsMore than any other branch of service, the Army National Guard offers a wide range of intelligence-related positions. Through your training, you will develop skills and experience to create opportunities for a civilian career with federal agencies like the National Security Agency.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to learn. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance and certifications. Job training for an Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 13 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practice in intelligence gathering. You'll learn in the classroom and gain experience in the field. Completion of your initial entry training in the Army National Guard could also lead to additional college credit.Benefits/RequirementsBenefitsPaid trainingEarn a security clearanceA monthly paycheckMontgomery GI BillFederal and State tuition assistanceRetirement benefits for part-time serviceLow-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)401(k)-type savings planStudent Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)Health care benefits availableVA home loansBonuses, if applicableMost non-prior service candidates will initially earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to change.RequirementsMilitary enlistment in the Army National GuardMust be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or GED certificateMust be between the ages of 17 and 35Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standardsMust meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability.Other Job InformationJob ID: 65ZIP Code: 36832Job Category: IntelligenceAge Requirements: Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 researcher
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: 35N Signals Intelligence Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionThe Army National Guard uses powerful technology to collect information from foreign signals, and it's the Signals Intelligence Analyst who makes it possible for the Guard to use this information to their advantage.Analyzing foreign communications helps our military experts better plan our Nation's defense. As a Signals Intelligence Analyst, you will intercept and analyze foreign communications; relay intelligence reports regarding combat, strategic, and tactical intelligence information; and study and locate radio signals to understand the tactics and organization of foreign military forces.Job Duties Maintain analytical working aids and databases Assist in the emplacement, camouflage, and recovery of surveillance systems Prepare technical and tactical intelligence reportsSome Of The Skills You'll Learn Analyzing communications information using technical references Preparing technical and tactical intelligence reportsHelpful Skills Interest in working with radio equipment Enjoy finding clues that help answer questions Ability to remain alert doing repetitive tasksThrough your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with government agencies like the NSA, the FBI, and the CIA, or other companies in private electronics and communicationcompanies.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.Job training for a Signals Intelligence Analyst consists of 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 18 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT), which includes practice in operating radio equipment.Benefits/RequirementsBenefitsPaid trainingA monthly paycheckEarn a security clearanceMontgomery GI BillFederal and State tuition assistanceRetirement benefits for part-time serviceLow-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)401(k)-type savings planStudent Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)Health care benefits availableVA home loansBonuses, if applicableMost non-prior service candidates will initially earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to change.RequirementsMilitary enlistment in the Army National GuardMust be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or a GED certificateMust be between the ages of 17 and 35Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standardsMust meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)Requires military enlistment.
